Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the remedies of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, sons, since you have completed this book, which is the last part of the science of medicine, for its completion and its consequences in it, and for its explanations and declarations, it seems to me that you will complete what I have written in this treatise, which is a part of my operation with my hand, so it is surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the operation with my hand is spread throughout our region and in our time of total privacy, until it has fortified the science of it, and its vision has been stopped; and I do not remain silent about it except for some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which muddy the waters and lead to those errors and hesitations until the intentions of it are closed and its force is elongated.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that you will vivify this ordering of this treatise in the second way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that you may come to the forms of the instruments of cautery and of other tools of the work as it is for addition to the declaration, and for preparation of it, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why no artificial hand is found in this our time, is that the art of medicine is long, and it covers the skillful actor who has been exercised in the science of anatomy which Galen understood until he knew the juices of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and had knowledge of the bones, nerves and ligaments, and their number, and their position; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and of the places of their sensation.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this Hippocrates said that a name is not enough, but rather in the small work, and more in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already said that in the introduction of this book; because whoever does not know what we have said about anatomy, is not exempt from falling into error, for which many men die, thus you have seen many of them, because they are formed in this science and get away from it, and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	Because you have seen a foolish doctor who has attempted to incise an scrophilous aposteme on the neck of a woman, and has cut some arteries of the neck so that great blood flowed until the woman almost died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who promised that he would remove a stone from a man's bladder which had progressed to his state, and the stone was large, and he came to him and extracted that stone in a piece of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already called it a futile effort to extract that, and I saw that because of the greatness of the stone and because of the disposition of the patient's body, I knew that he would die under my hands.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who received a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and he made a bad incision on the patient's leg which was broken in his thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture, above the wound, with pincers and tongs, with strong traction, and did not leave the wound to heal.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then I dislocated the joint according to their desires, and then I relaxed it, and then I left it for several days and commanded that they should not move the limb; and it was thus until the thigh and foot were apostematous, and I came to a loss.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you have already called it a futile effort to him, and I had dislocated the limb, and consequently it was tranquilized and thus relieved of its pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But the corruption was confirmed in the limb, so that it could not be restrained, and it did not cease to spread the corruption in the limb until the patient's condition worsened.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who perforated a cancerous aposteme, and it became ulcerated after several days, until the evil of it was magnified in his lord's sight.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason is that the cancerous aposteme was pure of melancholic humor, and then it did not cover how it would come to him in entirety, but rather it was a member which suffered from everything, as if it had been besieged.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation with my hand be divided into two devotions: one is an operation associated with health, and another is a work in which there is danger in major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already existed everywhere in this book where I found operating in which there is error and fear; because it is necessary for you to watch over this and leave that, so that the fools do not find a way to speak and deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And then take up your arms in solicitude and protection of God, and your evils are fallen and are confirmed.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way for the grace of God to lose salvation and laudable success, and leave the terrible evils of difficult healing, and stop using your arms of that which makes you fear, so that it is established in your faith and in your name you are not evasive: because more remains of your glory, and afterwards in the world and lastly in your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Some people daily drink from certain sacred springs:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"There is no bad medicine for a bad patient, because bad doctors are not named."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	"And I have devoted this book to three chapters."
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	"Here begins the division of the book, and first of the first part."
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	"The first chapter deals with the head and feet, in the forms of instruments and in the furnishings of cauteries, and what is necessary for the operation."
La divisio de la segonda partida.	"The division of the second part."
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The second chapter, on scarification and perforation, and on cupping glasses, and on plasters, and on the extraction of arrowheads and on similar things, all chaptered and ordered according to the forms of instruments."
Divisio de la tersa partida.	"The division of the third part."
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of twisting and on similar things; a chapter ordered from head to feet, and according to the forms of instruments."
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	"On cauterization by fire and acute medicine and reminiscence of the operation."
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	"At this point begins the treatise on the entire book."
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	"I have described the quality of the juices of that cautery and its instruments, and in what complexions it is prohibited to use cauteries."
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	"Therefore I say that the sermon on the quality of the juice of cauteries and its instruments is a long and prolix sermon, subtle for science, and secretly hidden; and already many wise men have spoken about it, and they are discordant, and to me it seems sufficient to take a small part of their sermons, fearing prolongation."
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	"Therefore I say that cauteries conform universally to all complexions, which is a matter or several matters, except for two complexions, which are cold complexions without matter."
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	"In the cold and dry complexions there is a disagreement; for some said that cauteries are useful for those, and others said the contrary, that cauteries are not convenient in illnesses which are by quality and by dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that cold and dry illnesses are healed by cauteries which are hot and dry."
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	"And I say to him who says the contrary, that by cauteries it is made a remedy in all cold and dry illnesses that are found in men's bodies, because when you compare men's bodies with their humidity to the complexion of fire, you find that men's bodies are cold."
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	"And I say by the sermon of that, that experience has already taught me many times to discover."
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	"Moreover, I do not think that it is necessary to speak about that which has already been experimented and exercised in the chapter on cauteries by last exercise, and to know the diversity of complexions in men's bodies and the disposition of illnesses in their metesises, and the causes of those, and the accidents of those, and the space of time for those."
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	"Moreover, in the other complexions, it is not about your fear, and especially in cold and humid illnesses, because all doctors have agreed on those, and they do not disagree on the remedy with cauteries in those."
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	"And know, sons, that the secret of cure by cauteries is fire and its goodness, so concerning cauteries as a burning medicine, it is because fire is simple, the action of which does not penetrate except to the member which is cauterized and does not reach another member unless it is adjusted with a small benefit."
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	"Moreover, the action of burning medicine penetrates to that in the members where it is needed, and makes them come to the ailing member with difficult healing and makes them hear."
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	"Moreover, fire, by its subtlety and goodness of substance, does not do anything except to overflow; and it is already known to us through experiment and long service of study in the art about the truth of causes; and for that I have been excused from the length of the sermon; and if it were not that I did not leave my book open in this passage to you, secretly hidden with fire, and the quality of its operation in bodies and of the expulsion through which it expels illnesses, a philosophical sermon demonstrated, which would be acute in your feet."
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	"And know, sons, that they disagree on the time at which it is convenient to use cauteries and pause at the best time of spring."
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	"And I say that cauteries are convenient at all times, because the harm from the accidental time is submerged in the remedy of that which has been attracted by cauteries, and especially if cauteries are for pains or necessary pains, strong and steadfast, which do not suffer tardiness because they fear those that bring evil, which is greater than small harm entering through time."
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	"And thus you do not catch in your feet, or, sons, that which they do not esteem except the common people and foolish doctors, so it is that at that illness which is healed by cauteries, it is not returned to all time, and pauses at that consequence."
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not so much in the skin as in the cold humors that alter the complexion and dry out the humidity which is the cause of the pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Perhaps emperor's cauteries are excessive in medicine, to show off the value and truth of their operation and greatness of his noble lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his malady returns at some hour of time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of his malady, and the truth of it, and what is prepared in the course of his body by the aggregation of excessive heat in him, and what has come to him through his acquisition of vices and similarities to those causes; but that the malady in which cauteries are administered is a subtle malady in a member with few excessive heat and humidity, thus as cauteries of teeth for pain and similarity to that, it is possible that in him there will not return that pain, but rather it will be made small.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is a common saying that cauteries are the last resort of medicine, and it is a desperate remedy, not because they understand it in him, for they believe that it is not a cure that profits from medicine nor another cause that profits from cauteries.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is in contrast to that; and the intention that cauteries are the last resort of medicine is not but when we administer many ways of cure in certain maladies, and those medicines do not confer, and then at the end of the cause, one administers thus cauteries, and profits from that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And henceforth I reject the idea that cauteries are the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention which the common people and foolish doctors understand.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that gold cauteries are better than iron cauteries, and they didn't say this except for the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cauteries does not make a breach, as if it is not absolutely true, because you already have it and have experienced that it does not do this except in certain bodies, and cauteries are good and better than iron, just as they said; but when you make cauteries with a focus of gold, it is not for you to declare, because it is ignited according to the quantity that you want for the rigor of the gold, and prepares to receive heat; and if you adjust on the ignition it makes the gold flow into the focus, and sometimes in the focus certain layers so that the artisan can take advantage of it.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And therefore it is done to make iron cauteries, we must push lightly and more profoundly into the right direction of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And now I have ordered this chapter on cauteries according to chapters, and I have ordered those of the head within the feet, so that the demanding one knows what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cauteries for pain in the head due to coldness and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers on the humidity and coldness about the sudden accident of which there are two causes, so it is a cause of swelling and multiple fluxes of rheumatic flow, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the veins and ears fluent, and multiple sleeping, and of toothache and gout, and universally of all maladies that come from coldness, thus as paralytic, swooning, and apoplexy, and similarly in those maladies.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is this, that primarily it commands the patient to be evacuated from medicine by a mild evacuating remedy for three or four nights, according to the truth of the patient's virtue and his age and his custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then it commands him to shave his head with a razor, and then to sit between his thighs on a heated bench and place his hands over his own feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then he places the razor in the palm of his hand, then puts it on the razor's edge between the nostrils of his nose.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	Perhaps emperor, as the finger of my middle finger has arrived, it signs that place with tension, and then ignites the olive oil cautery of which this is the form.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then he places it on the tender spot with tension, in a manner that descends, in which the finger of my hand is constricted little by little, and you revolve it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then he lifts his hand lightly and regards the spot, and if you see already some quantity of head being discovered, thus as the quantity of grain of errors, then he lifts his hand, and if it does not return to that iron, another of that, if it is frozen, until it is seen by him what I have said to you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it on the spot and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place it on the wrapped cloth in a bundle and leave it there until the scar of the focus is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the spot with four-part medication until it is healthy.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the Roman plague was lifted, so much better did I get the arm, because it is better and more jovial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They should burn some of those that are to be cauterized on the outside of the bone, and hold the cautery so that it is adhered to some part of the bone's specificity.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then return it to its adjustment on the bone, and then it will be cured.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	They should burn others with the cautery penetrating deeply, so that it enters the bone strongly and grips the bone firmly, and this is the method of small alleviations.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They esteem that from that place issue the vapors of the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And it will be held in the open wound for a long time, and then it will be cured until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two special kinds of cauteries at all, unless in some homes according to the way of fear; and thus, you see, my better health is due to salvation, when it is; because the head is revealed by solution of continuity with the aforementioned, as we have testified in the other members, and especially since the head of the patient is of frail nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the species of cauteries first mentioned is most safe and better for me; and from that house and in that work I am healthy.
Capitol segon.	It follows accordingly.
Del cauteri del cap.	About the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When the whole head is affected by chronic and long pain and it is in prolonged illness, and uses remedies of poultices and of bandages and of cupping glasses and of emplasters and of ointments and of catheters and of gauzes, and especially if it has been cauterized with a cautery that recounts and does not provide relief from any of those causes, then consider that the head of the patient is of strong creation in its nature; and it is not frail and troubled by great cold, then that cauterying with another cautery below that one is insufficient.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauteries that one on the horn of the seven-headed beast with a cautery until the bone is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the bone and uncover the part of the bone that we have recounted and cauteries that with a cautery at the back part of the head in the place called "vas" — and it is that place where the windy pause is made.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And lift your hand in that way, and do not uncover the bone, because the patient will suffer great diverse pain from the pain of all the other cauteries of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you will direct this cautery to its place, because it is necessary that the cautery which is being used to cauteries the horns of the head and the occiput is more subtly applied than that which is cauterized in the middle place of the head; and this is the method of it.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cautery of non-ancient migration.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is pain in the head's part, or it is extended pain to the eye, it should be evacuated with medicines that mondiginate the head, and another cure should be administered, which you have mentioned in the treatises on illnesses; and if nothing helps, then cauterying is done in two ways: either cauterying with acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	The cauterying with acute burning medicine is that you take a handful of salt, and scrape it off and bind the extremities of it to both heads.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then incise the place of pain in the temple with a sharp lancet until it reaches the hidden bone, until it is concealed.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then strengthen it over the place where it is stopped by constant constriction, and thus leave it for three hours; and then remove it and extract the salt, and leave the wound open for two or three days, and then pause on the submerged edge in a bandage until the place forms a crust.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that one with an ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you see, do as I have written about some burning medicines which I have described in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	The cauterying with iron is done according to this method: ignite the iron for cauterying, of which this is the form.
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called "claus clavilhs", because the head of it is thus like a form of nail in which there is some curvature, and in the middle place of it there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then pause on the place of pain, and hold your hand — so that the acidity which is beneath is not adhered — and turn the small iron slowly with velocity.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of it that is adhered to the specificity of the bone thus as its magnitude, and lift your hand so that the artery is not adhered to the one beneath, so that there is no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then dip the edge in salt water and pause it on the place, and leave it for three days; and then pause the edge much in a bandage, and then cure it with an ointment until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cautery the extremity of the cutter according to the cautery, and beware of incision of the artery in this non-ancient migration properly.
Capitol quart.	Fourth chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cautery of ancient migratory diseases.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat migratory diseases in the way that we have spoken of previous treatments, and in the divisions of the illnesses, and do not hasten the treatment, and sometimes due to the illness that does not allow for what we have said about the first cautery in medicine or in fire cautery, then it is necessary that you ignite the cuticular cautery until it is whitened, because it signifies on the line of long duration of the same magnitude, or that which; and pause your hand for a while and strengthen it until you incise the artery and penetrate into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuity of the jawbone, which is weakened by chewing, and that the ligament is not injured and the nerves are not damaged in such a way, and that there is no spasmodic contractions.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and caution of the flow of blood in the artery that is constricted, because in the constriction of it there is fear, and greater harm to him who ignores what he does and is not skilled and experienced; and thus the operation begins with him at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will find a remedy in the memory of the regulation of blood flow accidents in the artery, according to the usual method, in the same place of this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this disease does not respond to this cautery and the body of the patient is tolerable, then cautery it in the same place on the head as we have recounted, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cautery which we have said in the chapter on stretching of arteries with cautery having two handles, and it is a better cautery for this and more convenient.
Capitol .v.	Chapter five.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cautery of ear pains.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain from cold and it is treated with causal remedies and another treatment which has been said in the division, and the pain is not alleviated, then ignite the cautery, and this is the one that has been named punctual, of which this is the form.
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And point the cautery at the ignition, and it should be led around the entire ear as if it were being turned, or in a circle of any shape if the pain is anywhere.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Also, I will teach you about the cautery of the root of the ear, little by little, because you should sensibly touch the place with your finger.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if you make points of cautery in the entire ear, and thus it is, and then cure the places until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter six.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cautery of gout.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Gout, which is treated and cured with cautery, is not only of the species that come through flux, according to what we have said in the divisions of the illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	It requires cautery of the species that proceeds from dryness or spasm of the nerves.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that species of gout with herbs and head purges and gargles, and your treatment does not succeed, then it is necessary that you cautery the patient with three cauteries: the first at the root of the ear, the second a little below the same temple, and the third at the joint of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause your cautery for the opposite of the affected part, because mollification is not seen except in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cautery is that you cautery it with the cautery at the right of the extremity of the ear, slightly above the horn of the head, and in the temple another, the length of which is according to the length of the aforementioned finger, and pause your hand on the cautery until the quantity of the magnitude of the species of the codena is consumed.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is a species of cutting, the form of which is demonstrated on the table.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle because that one is a little thus as you see; and it is necessary to cut in it with excessive abundance a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place where it is demonstrated, until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter seven.

Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot. E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cautery is done according to what has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And then it is cautered on the mouth of the stomach; and it is more hidden; and then it is cured with what proceeds.

Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	About the cauterization of water descending into the wheel.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have declared the commencement of water in the wheel through the signs which you had said in the division, then begin and give to drink to the patient who is afflicted with that which moistens his head, and guard against total humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make that sugar dissolve in water for some days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command him to shave his head, and cauterize that with a cautery on the middle of the head; and then cauterize that with two cauteries on two temples if it is the commencement of watering in two wheels, or one side if it is the commencement of water in one wheel.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Including the veins and arteries which are beneath the codeina; and you will place the cauteries in that long length at the latitude of the temples.

E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you will find wisdom in the extraction of arteries and in the excision of those and caution against fluxes of blood.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some veins are cauterized at the neck beneath two bones with two cauteries, producing derivative effects.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	About the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses. Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	About the cauterization of foul odor of the nose.

Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	About the cauteries of softening of the eyelids of the wheels.

E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then pause over the cauteries for a while, and then make the patient adhere to tranquility, and the limb should not be moved for some time until it is comforted.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is above and it is done thus, then cauterize over the muscle with a key-shaped cautery or three pointed cauteries, because the joint is confirmed and the humidity is removed and the patient is healthy.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On the cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When cold and humidity enter the stomach to the point that it extracts its completeness and is multiplied into it, and if you continue the manners of cure and do not confide, then it is necessary for the patient to be on their back raised, and extend their arms and legs, and then cauterize that with three cauteries: one cautery below the chest for the quantity of a finger in a key-shaped cautery, and two cauteries below the two sides of the cautery, until the triangular figure of the cautery is obtained; and elongate between those that are not adjusted so they do not make putrefaction.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery equals the amount of the two thirds of the thickness of the cartilage.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And this is the shape of the cautery according to this form, and if you wish, make a large cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form; and this should be a cautery according to the circular form.
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And the stomach should be cauterized at the point where it is frightened by this cautery: and it is that you feel on the stomach point according to the quantity that you wish to hold, and then cauterize it with this cautery at the points; and then cure it with the cure that precedes until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On the cauterization of the cold fever.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When the fever is induced by coldness or humidity or gross ventosity until the normal complete complexion is gotten through excessive egress, and it is cured with the medicine that we have said and not comforted, then it is necessary that the patient be resupinated on their bed, and feel with three cauteries according to this form and this measured quantity on the feverish place below the hip, where one perceives the decubitus of home.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And this is the space which is between each cautery according to the thickness of the finger, and it should be a cautery according to the length of the right body.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not include your hand in the motion of the cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount of water that has been absorbed is equal to the amount of the marrow of the cartilage, and it is not yet adjusted; and if the patient stands on their feet; and if they are not standing, then let them sit, who has already extended their thighs, and lifted their legs.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible that you can cauterize these cauteries with a cutting cautery, when you are with subtlety and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And beware that you do not proceed too quickly in the cauterization, and it is absorbed the specificity of all the cartilage so that it is absorbed throughout the body and penetrates into the intestines, because the cartilage here is subtle; and you will know this.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the perforation of an abscess of the fever with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is an ulceration or abscess in the fever and you want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the fever or in its tunic, then if it is in the flesh of the fever, the patient will be troubled with grave gravity and pain will be acute.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the tunic of the fever, then the pain will be greatly acute and many times the doctors are exhausted from curing it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore it is necessary that the patient be turned over onto their bed; and then feel the place of the abscess with your hand; and then ignite the cautery which is assembled like a rag, in the form of which has been described on the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that cautery until all the cartilage is burned away, until it reaches the siphac, until it makes a sane scar.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with the cure of other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And it is not fitting that from this form of cautery use except that which the student in the art of medicine has prolonged, and in the hands of which many maladies are known; more I have experimented on some vague occasions and have been bold about this operation, more I have left those writings to you, and it is better.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the cauterization of ulcers.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancient cauteries of the roots of aristology ulcerate according to this manner of being made, and it is this that you take from the roots of aristology a long dry root which is found, and it should be of the thickness of a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	And then submerge it in oil and expose it to fire, and then cauterize with a cautery at the place where it is between the continuation of the furcula and the neck; and there are two small cauteries below guiding, one slightly declining towards the part that is below the beard, and there are two cauteries in what is declining between the fifth rib and the nipple, declining slightly towards the back parts; and there is another cautery at the middle place of the foot, and another on the stomach, and three cauteries on the back parts; and there is a cautery at the place where it is between the two shoulders, and there are two cauteries of the two sides of the foot, below the cautery that is between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And it is not fitting that you include your hand in the cautery, but rather it should be in the manifestation of the cartilage in operation.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And thus I have described the ancient ways that are ancient among men who use iron-like cauteries resembling a ray and ignite them, and place them at the place where it is between the ribs, until they reach that abscess and make a sane scar, just as we have said in the abscess of the fever.
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	In this perforation, do not use pointed cautery, because too much humor accumulates in the location of the fistula, which is not healthy.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter .xxx.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On the cauterization of the thigh.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat the thigh ailment in the way we have discussed about treatment in division and do not confuse your treatment, then cauterize in three manners, all of which are direct, one of which is to make three or four lines according to the length of the thigh, following the shape of the cauteries of the foot, whose shape has preceded.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And let there be between each cautery the width of a finger or a little more, and the manner of the cautery should be the manner which we have mentioned in the cauteries of the foot, similarly.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not comprehend your hand at the cautery; and the patient should be seated on a stool with two legs.
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another manner of cauterizing, that is to ignite the cautery having two vertiments, which causes we have mentioned in the chapter on muscle dislocation, and it raises the codeine which is at the end of the thigh where the patient feels the pain on the affected side.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And let your elevation be the one that raises the codeine according to the length of the body, so that you make pointed cauteries according to the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then insert the two vertiments, ignite motion, in that entry where they penetrate the codeine of the other part.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then extract the cautery; and thus make four pointed cauteries.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three vertiments.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you will cure the cautery better than having to grasp or bend for three days, because it is more comfortable than the other causes preceding in the treatment.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter .xxxi.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On the cauterization of dropsy.
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cauteries are not made in dropsy, but rather in a specific location properly.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you treat the dropsy, in the manners of treatment which we have mentioned in the division and do not confuse your treatment, then it is necessary that those cauteries are four cauteries around the navel, and one cautery on the stomach, and another cautery on the foot, and another cautery on the thigh, and two cauteries between the vertebrae of the back, and one cautery on the right side of the foot, and another cautery on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the quantity of the depth of the cautery should be proportionate to the specificity of the codeine.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then leave the cautery open so that you hold or bend for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not evacuate the patient from treatment then with the cautery as it is necessary for them to be added to the two intentions, and it will be fastened to the doctor's healthy aid.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery that is cauterizing the belly is club-shaped according to the shape of that which precedes, and it is that which is cauterizing the back and is olive-shaped according to its preceding form.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter .xxxii.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	On the cauterization of feet and of the thighs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are apostematized in dropsy and are full of stagnant water, it is necessary to cauterize the feet on the back of the foot at night, where it is between the auricular and anular, and raise your hand on the cautery and do not twist it; and then raise your hand, and do not return it entirely, because the stagnant water recedes.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cauteries are according to this form: And then make pointed ones on the two thighs, and in each thigh a pointed cautery at the extremity of the cutting cautery.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And the cauteries are according to the length of the thigh: one on the denolh and another on the middle place of the thigh; and on each thigh two cauteries.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And then leave the open plague for a long time, so that some water recedes from it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then cure them with those causes which we have mentioned.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter .xxxiii.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On the cauterization of the belly and abdomen.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the belly and abdomen are cold and humid inside so that they debilitate the vertebrae, it is the digestive and retentive virtue, which are in the stomach and intestines, and it is cured with those manners of treatment and do not confuse, and sometimes the patient suffers from exhibiting vertebrae cauteries, then cauterize them with a large cautery on the navel according to what has preceded in the cauterization of the stomach, with the circular cautery and four cauteries in the subtle circuit of the navel, with a subtle club-shaped cautery; and with a cautery on the alcatin above the great aloes, or with two cauteries.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if sometimes the humidity exhibits and the patient tolerates, then cauterize them on the pentenilh and on the intestines, and strongly adjust two cauteries on the stomach and near the inguinal region, because it is a perfect cure of youthful vigor, from which you do not err.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On the cauterization of ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When they are in the nature of old hemorrhoids or one of gross humors that corrupts or humidities corrupted, and are cured with what has been said in the division and does not conform to the proper cure, then cauterize with three cauteries above the pus below the spine of the small back, and with a cautery above the umbilical region for two digits.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if it happens that their stomach is inflamed and their food is not digested, and their face is often apostemated, then cauterize that above the stomach with a large cautery according to what has been prescribed; and with a cautery on the side, and another cautery on the navel of theirs with a clave-shaped cautery, and leave the cautery for some time open, and then cure them from the inside so that they may be healthy.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On the cauterization of athelia, proper for their abscesses.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you abscess athelia, then you ignite the cautery that is assembled in a row.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then insert that ignited cautery into the abscessed athelia, and ultimately apply it inward so that you bring the cautery to the orifice of the vein from which the blood flows.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And make a vein or two, because if the achieyl are too many, then cauterize some of them according to what has been recounted, and then cure those who have veins that conform to their own joints so that they may be healthy.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery on the alcoves, it is more durable in youth.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On the cauterization of fistulas that are formed in the nature of their own parts.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When the nature does not obey the work that has been recommended in its place, and the patient is frightened by it, then heal with a cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	So when you have a fistula in the old nature, and it is antiquated, corroding their health and humidities corrupted, and so that which is more worthy than the one that covers is that which proceeds with a subtle tension, and then conveys the quantity of the profundity of theirs before the aforementioned tension.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then ignite the cautery that is similar to a row.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And then insert that ignited cautery into this fistula, and according to the quantity in which you introduce the tension.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And iterate over that cautery inward so that they burn those corrupted bodies all together one or two or three times, according to the quantity of your necessary need.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And beware of combustion of nerves and veins; or if the fistula goes to the body of the bladder or to the body of the intestine, then beware of all those places; and do not do it unless the fistula is in a fleshy place and you think that it does not penetrate.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place inward so that it may be healthy.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the place is sealed, and you have abscessed from them the materials, and remained thus for a long time, then you will know that it has been fully cured.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the materials are not abscessed from them, then you will know that it is penetrating or in the region of their corrupted bone, or thus because of those causes which will bring remembrance to its place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On the cauterization of the kidneys.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in the kidneys there is pain due to cold or gross ventosity, and thus the coil of the patient's thigh is weakened, then it is fitting that you cauterize above the kidneys with a clave-shaped cautery on each kidney, from which proceeds the remembrance.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And strengthen their cauterization in the second little behind, so that three linear cauteries will come, and then they will be more durable in youth.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On the cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When there is debilitation and mollification in the bladder due to cold and humidities, so that the patient's urine does not retain, then cauterize that in the part below about the bladder, where the skin of the perineum begins, and cauterize with a cautery on the right part, and another on the left side of theirs.

And the length of each cautery is according to the quantity of notes on the foot; and cauterize that with a cautery in the part below the lower back, or with two cauteries if it is necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And it is a clave-shaped cautery according to what has been proceeded.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On the cauterization of the matrix (womb).
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When cold and humidity come to the matrix (womb), and thus it is prohibited from conception, and their menses are corrupted, and the provocation of theirs is delayed, and there is pain because of the havement of theirs, then it is fitting that the place be cauterized with three cauteries in the circuit of the umbilical region, just as we have said in the cauterization of the bladder; and with a clave-shaped cautery above the place below the back, or with two cauteries.

De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On the cauterization of dislocation of the ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moisture accumulates and is retained in the ankle joint, and it causes inflammation of the surrounding tissue, and it seems that the thigh is prolonged over the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of the dislocation is palpated in the said boy's thigh.

Then you should cauterize the patient's ankle joint with a circular cautery, because you have sensed that it is tense in the circuit of the joint, and thus it revolves, and so that the joint falls into its proper place within the circle.

De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the ankle joint, and it is caused by cold and moisture, the patient is cured with what we have said and not contradicted, and what is ancient, then you should remove the patient from gross humors with fetid pills or artificial pills or similar; and then cauterize.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the manner of the cautery in that is according to two manners: either cautery with burning medicines, or cautery with fire.

Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra. And I will describe the wise men in the cauterization of ankle joints, which is this manner: make a circle of iron wire whose circumference is the size of one palm; and it should be from seven or eight inches, according to the thickness of one finger's bone or a little less.

entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it will be very red and have many sparks.
