E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then treat those who have other afflictions until they are healthy.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And let the patient sit on a soft couch for forty days until the area is sealed and the plague.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And be careful that you pause the nourishment of it according to the length of time of its cure, which lines up with the belly of it, and that the intestine does not come out during the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And then when one wants to get up after forty days, then administer gentle and decent food, and hold that for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And be mindful of toil and replenishment of food and drink, and of violent vomiting, because when one uses this entire regimen of healing, they will surely be healthy.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And you will direct the healing of ruptures in other parts of the belly, and so from the beginning, and you want that they do not burst, then cauterize the rupture of that which is being cauterized abundantly according to its quantity, and it is that which is exhaling from the codena as well as the third part of it; and then treat that which we have said, and it will be adjusted.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And you will find some primary rupture that is cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, because it is signified by a tender point.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And it is a paused line that goes for the width in the flesh because it surrounds the rupture, and another line below; and place your hand with a keyed cautery, but the first cautery is better and more gentle.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the Cauterization of Hernia.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When an injury occurs in some members by fall or by percussion pain and it persists for a long time and does not respond to medical treatment, then be careful to cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And it is the cautery of each member according to its size and smallness, and its strength and development, and location of hernia and pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore if it is not healthy from the first cautery, well; and if not, then iterate over it with the cautery; because of the custom of those pains it is that they are punctured in a member next to that member which approaches you, so that you be careful to conserve those with the cautery until the patient is healthy.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the Cauterization of Leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	The leprous ulcers are treated with a cautery for great improvement, and magnificently if the species of leprosy that is made by putrefaction of flesh and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so when you want to cauterize that, consider if the leprosy is common and as that cured with what we have said in the division and not delayed, nor this, and fear about the patient that the corruption comprehends the whole body of it and its entire complexity, then cauterize that on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and one below it, and another on the forehead to the end of the hairs; and two above the horns; and one behind, on the nape or neck.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally place your hand with the cautery a little inside so that you press on the bone a small impression, and from it the scabs are dislocated, so that the expiration of gross vapors is alleviated; and cauterize on the molars according to what is prescribed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the patient and appears manifestly, then be careful to cauterize that with those cauteries which we have said on the head; and one cautery on the extremity of the nose, and two cauteries on the two molars, and two cauteries on two vertebrae of the neck, and six cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and one large one on the vertebrae near the hip, and one on the hip, and two on the loins, and one on each loin, and two on the ankles, and one on each ankle, and two on the knees, and two on the muscles, and two on the tendons of the soft foot; and cauterize that on all the joints of the said limbs and feet, and on each talon of the soles of the feet, and on the foscils of their hands.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And beware of the nerves that are above the ankle that you do not burn those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And some ulcers are cauterized with a cautery on the bone of the thigh and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And you should know that the more you adjust the cauteries, the more it improves and the more it confers; and you should know that the patient does not have pain in the cautery, as they have said, so that the body of it is already stupefied.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	It seems that this sentence means:
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the cautery in the fire of burning coals, mixing well and making another healing within so that it is healthy.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	About the cauterization of numbness or stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a member is numb or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and emplasters, and it is not healed, then you cauterize that numb member with cauteries according to the greatness of the member or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery enter the inspection of the cord in a little while.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that one who is wounded, until it is healthy.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And some wounded people are cauterized for certain numbness which goes to the hands and feet, and to the vertebrae of the back and eyes, and it is the movement of the nerves which makes that member, and the numbness is relieved.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not presume upon it except for one who is skilled in the anatomy of the members and the exit of the nerves throughout the whole moving body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	About the cauterization of ulcers that are gangrenous.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When ulcers are old and do not respond to the usual remedies of medicine, then you cauterize over that ulcer with a pointed cautery for a little while according to the quantity of the specific cord until the whiteness and color of it are restored, and its color is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that ulcer with the fire of coals and of lentils, with rose oil and with leaves of dragon's blood, and with dove's blood or pigeon's blood, each one a part and all are mixed together, and then let it be anointed with a cloth and placed over the area until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter 50.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	About the cauterization of cancer.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer is beginning and you want to remove it, then cauterize that part with a circular cautery around the circumference of it, so that it is completely removed.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And I advise the wise ones that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle place; but to me it has not been seen, because I fear that it is ulcerated, and you have already seen some wounded people.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is better to return to the previous method of cauterizing in a circle around it, as we have said, or with multiple cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	About the cauterization of indurations.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some indurations are delayed in maturity, and thus it is because of the superfluous fat that makes them, or because of the state of the patient, which is old and decrepit, with little blood, or because of the time, and you want to hasten the maturity of indurations; then cauterize around the circumference with many small pointed cauteries; and afterwards let it be, for it will fasten in maturity.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	But if you want to make a perforation with the cautery, then you ignite the cautery of which this is the form; and place it in the middle of the induration until it penetrates the cord.

Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	About the cauterization of corroding ulcers.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corroding ulcers are corrupting wounds in the member, which corrode as if a focus of dry gangrene is eating away.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Then if you want to cauterize that corroding ulcer in the place where it suffers from a focus, then you ignite cauteries with many small nails, and large ones according to what is convenient in that place where it is corroding.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize that entire part until you eradicate all the corrosion and there remains no cause of it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then let it be for three days, and apply over the cauterized places a triple ointment mixed together until all scars are totally eradicated and all corruption.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then heal that wounded flesh generating new flesh.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days the flesh is born healthy in which there is no corruption, good; but if not, then repeat the cautery over that which remains corrupt in the corrupted places.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And corroding ulcers are treated with some old remedies of acute medicine, because that is half in place of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But the emperor's cautery is of worse reputation, and it is to be used with more judgment.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And you have already said the cure of the member with acute medicine in the division, and therefore take that when the hours of urgency come.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	About the cauterization of wounds and of other similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many wounded people go to the lower parts of the foot with maladies which are called wounds, and it is a gross, inward cause, which takes away the foot; and cauteries are made in those places according to two manners, that is to say, with fire and with water heat.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	The more cauteries are focused where they ignite like a fiery furnace, the one that is made of iron according to the quantity that it contains in its entirety, and is of subtle margins.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then stop the ignition on the nail, and return your hand to the cautery in the circle of the nail until the cautery reaches the depth of the nail.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave it like that for three days until you start to feel better.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply a plaster made with soothing mallows, saved and crushed in salt, and leave the plaster on for a night, because it will eradicate its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the place affected by generating flesh until it is healthy.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and you have applied poultices on the surface of the body, mainly on the hands and feet, then it is necessary that you administer to those cauteries in water, and it is that you take a small tube of iron or of fiery furnace, and place it on the nail; and then put your hand in the tube of hot water, and hold it, and you return with compression of your hand all around, and it is inserted into the margin of the tube at the root of the nail, and you extract the hot water through the hole at the root of the toe; and wait for a little while, about an hour, for the bite of the hot water to penetrate, and then remove it, because the nail with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus do to those ones and then add another until you come upon all the whys of their suffering in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then heal those pustules because the roots of the nails are eradicated, and the flesh will regenerate on its own.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter 3.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the cauterization of trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When you have a trembling due to cold in the nerves or fever caused by cold, or another similar cause, then it is necessary that you cauterize with four cauteries or five on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra a cautery; and a cautery on their chest, and on their stomach, a cautery on the olive-shaped spot.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of it is restored and strengthened by the health of the patient's cold constitution.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 4.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the cauterization of sudden accidents to the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When the body is suddenly afflicted, and there are pustules that are made of gross corrupt materials; therefore it is necessary at the beginning to appear, that it be cauterized on every head of the fistula with a subtle cautery made of myrtle, the extremity of which is extended into a fiery point; or with a long herbal root; or with a slow-burning cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.
