Capitol lvi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On the cauterization of fluxes of blood due to accidental injury of an artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Many applied poultices flow from the artery that is injured by the wound which it has in front, or by the beginning of abscesses or cauteries of the limb, and therefore it seems difficult to remove that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore when it reaches to that point, then you should hold with your hand at the orifice of the artery, and stop there until the flow of blood is stopped, and it does not come out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then stop at the focus of the olive-shaped cauteries, few and great in number, and extract them until they are completely ignited.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take from those a small or large one according to the place and wound in which the artery is broken, on that vein firmly holding it back so that you may reattach the orifice, and return the cautery until the blood is confined and restrained.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the orifice of the artery when you reattach the orifice and extract the cautery, then take another cautery carefully prepared from the cauteries which are in the focus, and thus do not cease to do this until the blood is restrained.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And beware that you do not touch the nerves which are here, and that another evil comes upon the patient with another malice.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And you know that when the arterial flow of blood is strong, then it is not possible to restrain the blood in those, and especially when the artery is large, if not one of four methods: either with a cautery as I have said, or with extraction when it is not extracted, because when it is extracted the extremities of my veins are burned and the blood is restrained, or that it be tied with a strong ligature, or that it be stopped by medicines which have the virtue of restraining the blood; and they are strengthened in the pulvinar with a decent constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	Those who administer restrictive diet to the patient with a wounded limb and a strained joint, or drops by positioning causes combustion and similarity, do not comfort unless it is bitter.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if there is an end to the disease and it does not seem like a doctor's presence or medicine, then work on the treatment of the indicated finger over the orifice of that vein, thus having said, and understand the great constriction within so that the blood flow is obstructed from the superior part of the plague, and above the artery it does not seem to be reopened; and above the artery, it seems to be constricted by a great deal of coldness within so that the blood flow is congealed and thickened; and but you may try if there is need for cautery or necessary medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	It begins with the second treatment.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation and of vein sections and of flea-biting and of sores and of their similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the teachings of Albucazis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	I have said in the first chapter all about malady in which cautery fire is convenient and burning medicine, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary for the forms of cauteries; and I have ordered the chapters according to the subordinated arrangement of the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter with that method, so that it may be clarified to whoever wants it, then above what will be demanded.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And therefore I begin here, cove, son, that you learn that in this chapter is to terrify whoever it is from the first chapter of cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for that which is in great caution, because in the operation which is in this chapter many evacuated catheters are thrown away, which is with blood in which there is life by means of aspiration of the vein or incision over the aposteme or percussion of the exsiture or purification of the plague or extraction of a dart or incision of rock and their similarities.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all those accompany fear and trembling and in the end of their cat [patients] death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that upon you does not fall that which is in the sitting, because some evacuated cases happen to you in the manner of men who have many manners of maladies.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of them it is certain that they will flee from their malady and it is far from them the death, and thus for the vehemence of that which finds its malady, and for the length of the malady of him, and in the malady it is fear for that which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those it is the one that gives to your son to have and to say, you hope for that health, and the following malady is pernicious.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore do not think that you consent to that which is seen by you of this manner; and your caution should be greater than what is thought and your rapidity; and do not presume any cause over that unless certain scientific knowledge verifies it for you, and at which point you perceive successful success.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And you will be established in the cure of all your maladies by prognosis and indication of him which is converted salvation, because in that it is to you helpers above acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, sons, God inspires your understanding and does not lack direction and protection, because that is in His hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter distinct from chapters according to what precedes in the chapter of cauteries, of the cure from head to feet, so that it may be clarified to you what you demanded of it and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water that is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	You know that this malady many times ends in children from birth and when the nurse strengthens the child's head with their livelihood.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And some evacuated cases end because of hidden cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this malady except in children; and to all those whom I have seen it has been the sign of death, and thus it is to me a sad and lamentable work in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child's head which was full of water swelled, and the child's head was so magnificent until it ceased to be able to support itself by means of the greatness of its head, and more that the humidity made it increase until it died from heat.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity or is added between the skull and the bone, or is added beneath the bone above the siphon.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	Because the operation in that case if the humidity is between the skull and the bone and the aposteme is small, then it is known that you find in the middle of the head with a fissure in the latitude, and let the length of the fissure be two inches until the humidity runs, and this is the form of the spatula.
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if the humidity is more increased and the aposteme is greater, then there are two fissures here in this manner.
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	If humidity is in the bones, it seems that you have taken the entire top of the head away from the partitions and the water is squeezed out when you comprehend that the tie is tight on the partitions and not squeezing out to your amazement.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	I think you have found three fractures in the middle of the head according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then extract the excess humidity; and then strengthen the fractures with draps and plasters; and then apply something on top for six days, and then remove the bandage and cure the wound with tentacles and unguents, and strengthen the head in equality; eat the patient with dry food of little humidity until the member is comforted and healthy.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision, which considers how to appear the magnitude of the abscess and the collection of water, because some veins are more in the occiput, or in the front, or on the right, or on the left; and then attend to the incision so that the abscess appears and the water is replenished, and do it according to what is most possible for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not cut the artery and avoid those flowy veins of blood and marrow, lest the patient die from that flow of blood with evacuation of humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter 2.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	On the incision of the arteries which are close to the auricles, called Hilassysses.
Capitol segon.	Chapter three.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When you find some catarrh or rheum in the veins or on the feet, and it is antiquated, and does not confer on that the cure of medicines, then the last cure is to make an incision on those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And then know when you want to incise those that the patient's vein is near the head, and then clean the place with a sharp drap for so that the arteries appear, and then strengthen the neck of the patient with some drap; and then consider the pulse of the vein; and the places on each of them above the places which are close to the auricles, and so they are hidden until in some homes.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then place a thread above the artery with a tent, and then incise each one in the space of each part of the head, making an incision penetrating into the bone, and it is so for the latitude of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, enter the space below the artery and cut through to the incisions at the top parts.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And it is the length of the incision that measures two digits adjusted, because when a vein is incised, the blood flows out in pulsating egress, which bursts forth frequently before calming down.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear at the incision site, then know that you measure from the auricle the quantity of the space of three digits, and then place a thread with a tent, and make it enter into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And it is known that one gets rid of the blood flow which is a quantity of six ounces. and it is far from getting more or less, and all that is according to the quantity which appears of the virtue of the patient and of the replenishment of the artery of it.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the wound, and if there remains on the bone some cause of the cyanosis, then incise that so that no abscess is formed cautiously.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with plasters and bandages of cloth, and then cure it with unguents until it is healthy.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When some ancient or chronic catarrh flows, due to humid aggravations and quality in the veins of the temples, or an old vehement and similar thing, and it is medicated with various methods of medical cure, but it does not confer, then we have proceeded to extract the arteries from the temples, or cauterization of those thus as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of operation and extraction of those is that the patient's vein is near the skin which is in the temples; and it tends to the apparent artery in the temple because it is shown to you by the pulse, and it is hidden until in few homes due to the vehemence of the flow.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden, then the neck of the patient should be strengthened with some cloth; and then clean the place with a sharp drap or evaporate the place with hot water until the artery appears manifestly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the space of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you score the cord with which this is facilitated until you reach the artery; and then get onto it and extract it from the superior parts until you extract it from the cord and discover it from the tunics which are beneath it, of the entire part.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is subtle, then envelop it at the extremity of the ounce, and then incise that one part according to the quantity for which the extremities of it are lengthened and contracted, and there will be no flux of blood, because if it is not incised, the blood will not flow at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate the blood from the vicinity of the affected area. Enter three drops.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the acidity is great, then it is necessary to lie down in two places with a double strong bandage or with long cords, and do not touch the putrid matter during the consolidation of the wound and ending the flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then incise the excess which is between two ligaments; and do it at that hour or then another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize that with a cautery into the bone, or with a cutting cautery into which the extremities of it are incised, and stay in place of that same work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better work because the patient has fever or is of complex composition; for cautery is among those causes that help to end humidity, and therefore it is better in youth.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary to extract the acidity that fills the place of the old wound, and then pause decently on the dust, and then be cured with dry medicines that make the flesh and bones healthy within so that it may be sanitized.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if meanwhile you work on another occasion to stop the flow of blood from the acidity, then you touch to restrain that blood, or with a cautery, or that fills the place of the wound, and stretch your hand within so that the blood is restrained.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of those causes is present to you, then pause your finger on the place within so that the blood is congealed, and wet the place with water of vehement coldness within so that the acidity repose, and be strengthened according to what is necessary.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And that which is more suitable in the extraction of acidity is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two points, since you have touched the two places with tension, and pause somewhat, not much, within so that they penetrate to the bone and cut the vein in two places, so that it may be elongated that which is between the extremities of it, because they are not consolidated at all with this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the acidity of the two points is tempered.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	Perhaps it is better to temper the acidity with two points, because if you agitate them with two points properly towards each friction, and do not incise the flesh with velocity.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	So since there is some grossness in those, it has held the heat of fire in those and the flesh is more quickly abscessed.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all works and more suitable.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the space which is between two points is the quantity of the grossness of the finger.
Capitol quart.	Fourth chapter.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the cure of bodies of sharp and acidic humors of the veins.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the veins are acidic, and it is the body of those veins which are above the head before falling, and do not find in that any cause of the cure by medicine, and sometimes the face of the patient already turns red and feels on the dry front of walking thus as if they were walking with ants, and the veins of that one are so exhausted, humidifying thus that already their skin is worn out, and the eyelids are so scalded by the acidity of the tears, the ancient wise masters in the cure of those of this operation, and I do not remember that cure in space.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And it is that you command the patient to walk with the skin which is on the dry front, and then incise in the front three fissures equally distant according to the length of the front.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the fissure falls into two digits: one fissure is equally distant to the length of the nose in the middle place of the front, and the second according to the length of a small movement of the eyelids which are in the lacrimal, and the third of the other part.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And beware of the beginning of the acidities which are in two sides, and elongate your hand from the continuity of both jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each incision is the quantity of three digits adjusted.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of spongy material prepared or dry cloths that absorb the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula of two sharp extremities, of which this is the shape of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the partition of the temples within to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Extract all that code which is between two incisions with the siphon which is above the bone, and then do it from the incision to the middle within to the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then straighten this spatula and insert it into the first incision another time with another instrument which is called a cutter, having one part sharp and the other not sharp.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And pause the side of that sharp part towards the adjacent flesh of the code, and the side of it to the bone, and apply it within so that it reaches the middle fissure, and abscesses all those veins that descend from the head to the veins.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	It is necessary to continue the incision at that point to make an opening in the hollow of the knee joint, and then make it in the same way into another opening.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	Then pour a certain quantity of warm water, expressing the places of the swollen veins of the blood congealed.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And stop in each hot opening of the hip joint, and place on those swollen veins embedded with wine and oil, and take care not to inflame the aposteme with a cauterized instrument.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, loosen the ligature and administer a great abundance of warm water or decoction, and then take care to anoint with basilicon oil and rose oil, and others, so that the wounds may be healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the treatment of ulcers caused by catarrh and those descending from the injured parts of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When there is an acute catarrh and it continues, and sometimes the ulcers of the patient's thighs are greatly extended, and already their eyesight is weakened, and their eyelids are ulcerated and because of this their skin is rough, and in the forehead of the head there is sharp pain and subsequent exhaustion, then you will know by these accidents that the materials and catarrh do not come except from many veins of the injured parts proceeding.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for these is this: that you order the patient to shave their forehead, and then make an incision in a certain opening at the middle of the forehead, a small one for the width (and begin with the incision from the left temple to the right temple; and make it straight into the bone; and stretch out your hand from the tendons of the temples which are numb from the mastigation), until the bone is uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry out all the blood with a sponge or with dry cloth and then replace it between the two lips of the incision with hot hip joint or with dry cloths.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then strengthen beneath the swollen veins embedded with wine and oil, so that they do not inflame the post-operative wound with a cauterized instrument.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you see that the aposteme has already diminished, then it is time to scrape the bone until it begins to form new flesh, and then take care to apply a regiment of dry poultices which make the flesh heal, thus as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of colophonum and mix them together, and make a plaster and apply it to these wounds on the native flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of those that fall into the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	The entire cause that falls into the ears is one of four species, either it is mineral pebbles or a cause similar to pebbles, thus like iron and vein, or it is from a plant thus like cress or fava, or it is a fluxible cause thus like water and wine agree and their similarity, or some beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And then when pebbles fall into the ear or another cause similar to those causes that do not adjust in the ear, and stop the ear from the sun, and if times the pebbles, then distill in some oil of violet or sizami, and then administer the extraction of it, and make the storming with a condiment, and open the nostrils for the arrival of the storming.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then stop in the circle of the ear with some pieces of cloth or wool, and extend the ear to the upper parts, because many evacuated matters are forgotten in these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not evacuated, then administer the extraction of it with the instrument called gesti epicicarios subtiles, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is forgotten in the gestures, well; and if not, then administer the extraction of it with an instrument of subtle touch of little duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And then if it is not forgotten by that, then make a canal of silver and insert the extremity of the canal into the tube of the ear and close the environment of the canal with wax and oil softened so that nothing comes out except the canal.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract it with the tender vein which has strong attraction, because many evacuated matters have been recounted with water that they had.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	If it is not forgotten in this manner, then take alum bat or prepared viper's bugloss which has pressed the wings with a small quantity, and stop that at the extremity of the ray, and then envelop it decently paused.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the tube of the ear facilitated, and then dry the ear of humidity.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And then if it is not forgotten in all the causes which we have recounted, then you will take care to remove that from the teeth so that it does not inflame the post-operative wound with a cauterized instrument or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of removing that is that you at the beginning dry the patient's vein of the cephalic vein and extract the blood according to the manner of the virtue of it, and then make a circle between your hands and convert the ear to the upper parts, and find a small opening in the root of the ear where the veins of it are previously gathered.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	If the fracture of a lunar figure enters into the knee, and the knee is bruised, or it is necessary to apply an appropriate instrument; and apply it to the fracture at that hour with velocity, and cure it so that it may be healthy.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause of the pain is in the ear and it's one of the fat that grows and inflates, then administer the cure and extraction of it; but if you do not obey your own judgment, then take a subtle spatula according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer to that the absorption of that fat which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not think that it is humidified by the vapor of the ear, and stop it with gentle touches, and extract it from those corners or gestures subtly, or by subtle injection, as it has been said, because the extraction of it is alleviated.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water that has entered into the ear, because the patient uses sternutation to facilitate the commencement, and fills the whole ear with a lot of liquid, and pours it over the ear where the water is, and if by chance it is forgotten, be it; and otherwise, take three or four tender fingers according to the length of the digit, and place them in the focus of a little opening, and the patient inserts one of those into the channel of their ear and sounds above one finger of that party and percussionates with another finger on the finger which is behind the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Then stop pouring water into the ear until all the water has been forgotten.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water is forgotten, then you take pieces of paper or of cotton. and place one extreme end of it in the ear and extend the other extreme end into the focus until it is combined with the mucus of it.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And also place another cotton and make so many turns until all the water is forgotten, and draw it out with a canal just as it has been said about the extraordinary ear.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of beast entering into that ear, if it is a small thing, then push and pull it out similarly, cure it just as we have said in the division; but if it is a large thing which causes apparition at the time of vehement movement, then administer the extraction of it with gestures and corners, and the cause of it is purer than all other causes that happen in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of worms engendered in the ear, when you cure it with water as we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations and do not confuse your cure, then it is necessary that you expose the ear to the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And so if some cause of worms appears here, then extract it with gestures or subtle corners, but if no cause appears, then take a straight and narrow canal and draw out the abundance of which this is the form:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the subtle extremity into the ear according to the quantity which the patient can bear; and apply suction with water for strong sucking, and make many turns, until all the worms are forgotten.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if you do not obey your own judgment, then operate and close the circuit of the canal with wax just as we have said; then administer distillations which have already been experienced by the ancients in the cure of worms, and find it in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your effusion be the one in which you pour medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument, of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or copper, straight, in which there is a small hole, and placed thus.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And so it is how they fill the cavity of the canal, where it will be necessary to continue here.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the radish and wrap it decently in the extremity of the canal, and apply a gentle oil in the cavity of the instrument, or juice of some herb, or whatever you want of these medicines in the canal — and that is in the ear —, and then insert the radish with gentle pressure and express your hand so that the oil is expelled from the cavity of the instrument and the patient feels the oil dripping.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what has been poured into the ear should be warmed in a little focus.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And beware that the cause which you distilled into the ear is not too frequent, because ear medicines do not bear that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the Cure of Opilation of Ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some turns of certain enfantized yeast, which are not perforated, and that has already accumulated in some homes, opilation occurs in the middle of the ear due to plague or carnation in that; and this opilation is made in the prison of the ear's channel, which does not consent to vehement movement, and some turns are in the parts beforehand.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs in the chest of the patient, which does not comprehend the vein's movement, is in the major dispositions of difficult healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that which follows the vein's movement, it is necessary that you hold the patient's ear to the sun and look at that.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then if the apparent oppression sometimes occurs, observe that subtle spatium of which this is the shape of it:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of it is in which small width, of which one part is acute and the other not; and the spatium is of two lion's widths so that it does not touch the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And then if the oppression is due to a birthmark on the ear or in the marrow of it, then you have subtly and vehemently facilitated an entrance so that the entire flesh is restored.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the oppression is in the chest of the ear, then take a subtle lion's root and scrape that focus into a little hole, and then place it in the marrow of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And then if you have felt oppression in that which the patient has facilitated, due to the gravity of ascent, it forces the oppression of it to be facilitated; and beware that you do not plague the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then pause in the ear drip by drop according to the quantity of the width of the channel which you have enveloped in the Egyptian ointment; and do that for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the plague; or take some water and pour it into a jug and pulverize over the affected area and use it; and if the ear is already apostemed, then it is necessary that you extract the water and permute it with another water which you will envelop in wax so that it is made with oily roasting, until it is the aposteme cured; and then cure it until it is healthy.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	Maybe it occurs a flow of blood, then submerge a sponge or cloth in cold water and pause over the ear, and use another cure which restrains the flow of blood, which is described in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the cure of athelia, which falls upon the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athelia which falls upon the eyelids of the eyes, some of which are humid, some of which are dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Then it is necessary that you hold those with tenacious or pointed nails, and anoint those with the essence of their roots, and then pause over the affected areas.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	Maybe if pain with a flow of blood comes, then you cauterize those with a subtle, linear cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is to return the incisions and dry wounds when some cause of their roots remains; and when they are cauterized in focus, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Cure of cataracts that come to the eyelids of the eyes.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Moist humors collect in the eyelids of the eyes for some cause which is assembled with grandeur in its strength and hardness, and thus grandeur is called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an addition of gross humidity in the upper and lower eyelids.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Then the operation in them is that you consider then if the grandeur proceeds from it in that which appears from the eyelid and is magnified to the entire part; and the cause of it is laziness.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then make a fissure about that with width, and then scrape it from the entire part to facilitate until it evaporates, and then suspend it in a pointed instrument and separate it.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	Maybe if you have not prepared the incision of it, then you cannot penetrate the eyelid with a small incision little by little, then that does not appear in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you adjust it with a suture; and cure that until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not overcome evil by that which the angle of it restores and incarnates.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the grandeur is declining to the inner parts of the eyelid from the inner surface, then you evacuate the eyelid and suspend the grandeur in a pointed instrument, unless you indicate an incision, and press it from the entire part, and if the eyelid by incision is prolonged, that does not appear in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then make an incision, wash the eye with salt water; and cure the area with that which incarnates until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	On the cure of abscesses in the lower eyelid of the eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Abscesses are gray things which are engendered in the tunics of the lower eyelid, and they increase among infants, aggravate the eyes of those who have them, and cloud their clarity so that they cannot gaze at the brightness of the sun because the lachrymal glands become stuck to them.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And thus you often find them gazing at their faces for a long time, and at their faces while sleeping; and so on the lower eyelids of their eyes the humid eyebrows, which have already covered inflammation, and the imminence of apparent abscesses is in the eye; and when you press the area with your fingers, you feel abscesses until they are apparent.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	In some manual of operation it is necessary that the patient pause with his head in a certain position, and then place a cloth of linen or of a hot circle according to the quantity which contains the entire affected part, and then place that over that and press with fingers of the entire periphery so that an arc shape is formed in the middle of the circle, and then feel in the middle of that humidity accumulated incidentally in the fissure for the width, and the fissure should not be larger than the fissure which is made in phlebotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	Maybe in the preceding cavity you will find the entire code within which you reach to form an arc, because among the major deposits processes an arc for the fissure according to the shape of white crust.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then extract that humor which you have enveloped between the fingers and toes of the affected parts beforehand and revolve between the right and left hand until it is dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And beware that you do not adjust in the fissure so that the humidity does not reach the vein and descends to that.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	Maybe if the arc does not appear at the beginning of the fissure, maybe you adjust in the fissure a small facilitated humor until it processes an arc; and then extract that thus as we have said; and then submerge cloths of linen in water and wine and place them over the area and strengthen those humid powders.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And thus you will find that you draw out salt and place it in the cavity of the fissure so that what remains of that humidity is removed.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then heal that until it is healthy.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	Maybe if you find a post-apostemic abscess, then cure that with emplasters of Cedar oil until it is healthy.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	On the manner of touching the vein.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of the veins there are natural and ancient adjustments, then those nose towards the vein and make various kinds of evils, such as assiduous tears and mollification of the eyelids and skin until it is cause of destruction of the vein which is called touching of the vein, and it is cured in four ways: either by cautery with fire; or with acute medicine according to what has been said in the chapter on cautery; or it is touched through incision and suture; or with canes as you will be directed.

Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	Perhaps it happens that the abscess bursts, then you pause at what covers; or it is of the malignant apostemes, then you touch and cauterize that within which it is abscessed sane and all the cavities are opened.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And then it will be cut in the nose, then the incision will agree with water or wine.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	Perhaps the nose is open and of its processes humidity enters into the palate, then you know that it is already healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	Perhaps the humidity does not penetrate as it covers, then you know that it is flesh born in the purulent ulcers of the nostrils which have not reached abscession.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore then cover that you insert a thread of the same quality, and sew in the foot joints, and pause between each joint the quantity of the digit or month, and engineer the evil and insert one extremity of the thread into the nostrils with the radius or another cause which is possible.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And then it will be done, that the thread of the ornament enters into the channels of the nostrils, and it is established on the thread of the galleon, because many visions seem similar to this action, and it is a gentle cause for him who wants to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then pause the two extremities of the thread, one extremity that is above the nose and the other that remains in the nose, and then administer serrature of flesh on the joints that are in the thread, and make it enter until you know that the flesh is already in the joints of the thread.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then extract the thread, and pause in the nose according to the abstraction of the healthy skin a little, and make it so for three days or more until the enguient is corrupted all that is removed from the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the cause, pause in the nose a tube of lead for some days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	Perhaps there are ends of cure that exist, use that one.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument to purge the head, which makes distilled oils and medicines in the nostrils.
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And if you make use of silver or iron, which resembles a small lantern inserted, thus with a small tube, and the meat similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you want, make a closed canal thus with a tube, and the handle of the instrument is at the tip, plain, uncovered; which is held in the back of it, with which you hold that which you want to suck out of it or what you want of the juices and causes that flow.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And these ingredients are precious: a recipe of castor oil, of white clay, of ginger, and pilletre of saffron, of long pepper, of escarot, of epithim of spicy anise. You confound with the juice of bladder and of cabbage, and you make small pills, and one pill is dissolved in lukewarm water, and it is given through the nostrils of the patient who lies on his back.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	They are born naturally in the extremities of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Polyps grown are born naturally in the extremities of the nose, and it is magnificent and mentioned in certain days within which a mouth is readied for its observation.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And by means of that you examine what appears at the beginning of its appearance, and you eradicate all of it.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then place a pause on the area or apply a burning medicine which was previously in its place.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	If the ulceration is delayed within which it is magnificent, then consider if it is lapified, hard, of dark color and of little sentiment, then do not touch that with iron quar it is a cancerous aposteme; for polyps grown are added to that which ulcerates this great malice above that which it had.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the aposteme is of a Leon touch and not of dark color, and sometimes the ulceration is possible in all that, then evacuate the patient and ulcerate without fear, and cure the area with water that exhales and constrains until it is sanctified.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	About the suture of the nose and of the lips and of the ear when the continuity is dissolved by plague or by resemblance.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	You know that when you make a solution of continuity in one of these cartilages, few confer with that operation except in certain homes.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when you find some cause of those, consider if it is fresh plague with holy saint, and then adjust the two lips of the plague to suture, and afterwards cure that until it is sanctified.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of the solution of continuity are already separated, and each one is made healthy, then it is necessary that you extract each part of its apparent code until it becomes holy.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips to suture and strengthen them, and on them sprinkle holy dragon's powder and three times, and place on the powder a piece of fine emplastrum diafinicon, or some other of the consolidated emplasters, and let it lie for two days or three, and then remove that and change that emplaster and let it lie until the wounds are fully closed, and then cure with an ointment until it is sanctified.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	The manner of the suture is that you add the solution of continuity or with needles thus as we have recommended in the suture of the belly, or add the solution of continuity with thread thus as you and make it known.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	About the extraction of those causes that come in the two lips in the divided parts.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Polyps grown are found in some homes in the divided parts of their lips, certain apostemes hard resembling fat errors, and some of them are smaller and some are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, you convert the lips and find each one of those hardnesses in all parts, and then the abscess fills the place of holy trinity until the saint is restored, and then it is washed with a gentle agreement and the area is cured with water that is stipulated, until it is sanctified.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	About the ulceration of the flesh adjusted on the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	A great number of polyps born above the adjusted flesh of the gum, which the ancient doctors called albulus, therefore it is necessary that you suspend that with an onion or that you hold that with forceps and ulcerate that from its root, and let the healthy blood flow or the saint.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And then pause on the holy place of the Trinity or other stipulated powders or excitatives.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then ulcerate it secondarily, and cauterize it, because then the cautery will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	About the root of teeth with iron.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth in the divided parts and of those from the mouth and between the adjusted gums, there are rough, bitter, and some polyps are blackened and are made citrine or green until the gum is corrupted by that and the teeth are loosened.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	Therefore, you must make the patient sit between your knees and place their head on your thigh, and feel with your fingers to see if there are any hardened areas or signs of congestion in the veins that may be causing the pain, and this is due to the black bile and citrinitation and other inward disturbances that have become mondified.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	So if it is established that the cause is in those of the beginning of the reasoning, then it is; and if not, then you will continue the reasoning on another day and the second and the third day until you come to the last statement in what you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And you know that the fingers need various movements of different forms and shapes according to how they are prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And for this reason the razor has the quality of being sharp at the point of separation from the teeth, which is different from the razor that is rough between the teeth according to other forms, and these forms of razors should be prepared in a way that you will see soon.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter xxx.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	On the eradication of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	Because you cure the tooth of its pain in all respects and delays in total eradication of it, since there is no cause that supplies the evacuation of it when it is eradicated, because it is a sublime substance that excuses itself in the eradication of it.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	Moreover, because the patient is forced to eradicate that tooth, you should be firmly certified of which tooth is painful, since many evacuations alleviate the pain and convince the patient that it is a healthy tooth, and you eradicate it and then the pain does not cease until the bad and painful tooth is eradicated, for we have already seen this through the operation of the barbers.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Then how can you be certain which tooth is painful, and what you know, then it is necessary that you scarify around the circuit of the tooth with a spatulum in which there is some virtue, until it is dissolved from the tooth to the gum of the entire part, and then those teeth are loosened, or subtle forceps at the beginning little by little until that concudes.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then apply force with strong pincers for good articulation or sturdy extraction, and place the patient's head between your thighs so that you hold it firmly without wavering, and then extract the tooth according to rectitude in a way that you do not tremble, nor does the patient experience major pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And so if it is not forgotten, then take one of those instruments, and place it beneath the entire part to facilitate and force the removal of it, just as it was done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	Moreover, if the tooth is traumatized or corroded, then it is necessary that you complete the drawing of the root and strengthen it at the extremity of a subtle file so that it is not trapped during the time of your constriction over it with pincers.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.
