E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel it at all and there is no progression of the tract for any cause of evacuation or worm or wind, thus as we have said, then you will know that it is non-penetrating, and then you should proceed to the care.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula penetrates into the bladder or into the flesh of the penis, then the sign of it is the emission of urine from that and prohibition of it until the place where medicine is consolidated.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	But if it penetrates into the joint of the hip or into the bone and causes pain in the circuit, then the sign of it is that the thread passes through here if it is not twisted into the bone, and causes pain in the circuit of the part; and that sometimes it produces pus; and that it does not respond to that medicine, nor is it consolidated with the channel.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all those penetrating fistulas there is no complete cure, and the care of them is troublesome and vain effort of foolish doctors about which they boast.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in that which is not penetrating and not ancient, health is iron-bound and scattered according to what you have recommended, and that which has already been and proceeds.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And it is that the bad humor goes between your hands over the two fingers and raises its legs towards them, the hips are inclined to the belly, and then you insert a thread of lead, or of iron if it is in the twisted fistula, until you feel the place where the thread passes through.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if it feels the bad humor around the anus, then it is necessary that you insert your finger inside the anus.

And if you feel with your finger the thread that has been inserted to discover penetrating, or what you feel between your finger and the anus, then you will know certainly that it is penetrating; and then do not bother with it, because it is not in that health, thus as we have said.

And of the medicine by which they are suddenly helped in that is that you ignite subtle cautery according to the width of the fistula, thus as it has been preceded, and you insert that ignited thing into the fistula until it penetrates around the anus; and then it will take two or three weeks until you know that all those adjusted carns, fistulized and resembling a feather of a bird's wing, are completely healed.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And then you care for that with calques enveloped in bandages until all those adjusted carns are visible, and then you care for that with medicines that engender and consolidate the flesh, and if it is healed, good; and if not, then it is not healthy at any time through another cure.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	If the tension goes inside and does not penetrate into the thigh where it is in the back of the knee, and between that and the tension which is almost entirely flesh or cartilage, and sometimes a fistula forms on the surface of the codena, then dry the codena from the beginning of the fistula, and you see the drying of the tension, and it is in the fistula until the drying pervades to the place where it affects the extremity of the tension, and for the tension is liberated and freed.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then you should clean those festering wounds which are assembled around the canal of painful anguish and do not remove any cause from those wounds.

Maybe the flow of blood sometimes comes between you and your operation when you are cauterizing those wounds, then the thousand things that are and of the pus lie in the sharper instrument to cauterize with fire or acute medicine, because the cautery adjusts well to good habits: so it is adjustment of those adjusted wounds, and removal of the blood from excessive humidity.

And then you should cure those wrapped-up ulcers in a bandage or in a truss that goes to the place of the arm, and then cure the plague with a hard, enduring, and consolidating flesh.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And these medicines are those which are stimulating and purging; when then it is restored, it is already healed and does not fear relapse.

Maybe the fistula has already penetrated into the groin of the back and is elongated from the surface of the body, then enter the thigh within the back and investigate in that.

And so if you hold the tension and between you and it is almost cartilage or flesh, and it is ready for penetration, then it is not an operation on him but rather a path of trust and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	The cause is to administer in him one of three ways: either to cauterize that thus as we have said; or to dry that until you obtain the conquest of his body so that it is possible for you to enter the vessels and the propounded cure; and do not proceed with more drying lest you irritate the contained liquid, and that agrees with the malice of the governing will; and then cure that thus as we have said because strong sir health; or elongate that almost entirely and remove that pus which dries that until towards the back, thus as we have said, either with a pointed instrument or another sharp extremity, and then clean those festering wounds which are in the drying into the one who can make an incrustation; and then strive to do the restoration of all the plague in the drying, and if the horrific pus above is not consolidated, and remove the fistula opened in the part of the back, and it will be lighter for the malice.

La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes. De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	About the suturing of hemorrhoids in which blood flows during the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are thus according to two methods, because either they are between the back resembling thus that it is of carbon, or those are like a fat of rasp.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu. Maybe those that are outside the back according to the months of little humidity, from which flow water or a little blood with continuous flow, and thus according to the color of the body.

And the cure of that which is near the back is that you command the malice to settle and to expel it until the back is dry and the hemorrhoids appear to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you will feel and suspend an inch above that which you hold in your fingernail, and then cut those veins from their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	Perhaps the nails are not held in those for their humidity and softening, then take them with a rough cloth or a cotton pad, and extract them from the tender skin, and then cut them and powder over the burned areas with powdered caustics according to the incision; or cauterize them as described in the chapter on cauterizing.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then heal those with another cure until they are healthy.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the anus does not obey evacuation, then sprinkle the patient with a powder in which there is a small amount of absinthium, and wash them with that water which is in the colon and which helps to evacuate more easily when the patient is straining.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	Perhaps the hemorrhoids are in front of the anus, then the cause of them is evacuation, and it is that you take those with your fingernail, or take those with an inch, and cut them, and then heal those with water which we have mentioned until they are healthy.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And to the one who has an incision, it is necessary to administer a suture of them according to this method: take a thread wrapped around and insert it into a needle, and then extract the hemorrhoids from the upper parts, and make it penetrate into the needle in the root of the other part, and wrap the two extremities of the thread around the area below the needle, and so latitudinally; and strengthen the hemorrhoid in strong structure, and then knot the thread and extract the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And make them all whole, and leave one of those open and not sewn, so that the superfluity of blood can flow out from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And then stop above the anus with a cloth infused with rose oil or wax; and place that on the colon and command the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it until it crusts; and when it falls off, heal those with an ointment or another cure until they are healthy.
De curacio de fistulas.	On the cure of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Soft medicines applied by excision of a wound or by constriction of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And since they are antiquated and do not have value in that medicine, then it is necessary to root them out with the point of a spatula or with your fingernail until they are humid and held back by the scab, which prohibits their consolidation; and then heal those until they are consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you will remove those with reason, forcefully, that the first time until much blood flows and they are excavated; and then heal those until they are healthy.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	On the cure of gout, this is clear.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	You know that gout, this is clear, and it is not so if you do not notice the swelling according to the color of the body resembling a club hand, and it is made in all the body and especially in the parts below the feet and toes, and it ends for those who have that pain.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then it is necessary that what is in the circuit of the vein be cut, and held with forceps or an inch, and eradicated from its root; and then heal that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you want, cauterize the vein as described in the seventh chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	Perhaps a verruca is a small, rough, rounded fistula on the surface of the body, and soft medicines come in the hands of infants.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the cure of it is that you extend and cut them out, or that you strengthen them with a thread or a hair until they crust.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you want, cauterize it, as we have said, with fire or acute medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And already eradicated are the inward and outward (growths) with the instrument which you will direct.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	Perhaps a formica is a small, rough, gross fistula on the surface of the body, and when it touches that, it is felt in the likeness of a burning of ants, and it is made around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the cure of it is that you take a tube of pea or of nut, and make it strong, and place it over the formica until it contains the circle of the tube around the parts of it; and then revolve your hand with the tube until you cut what is in the circuit of the formica, and place it in the flesh of the patient, and eradicate the formica from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, make it with a tube of iron or copper according to this method:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The part below the tube should be subtle, solid (not perforated), wrapped so that on the said part the absorption of it is abolished and the revolution of it.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you want, cauterize the formica according to what has been previously said in the cauterization of atheyl in the chapter on cauterizing.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the manner of instruments that are administered to give Christ's cross.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Some crosses are made of silver or gold or copper foundry or alloy; and some crosses are made of those small and large instruments according to those that are administered, because the one that is administered for the treatment of small children should be small; and of those whose buttocks are fragile or delicate, the crosses of those should be small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of large and few Christ's crosses:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the cane of the patient from underneath which the bandage is wide according to this method; and it should be at a distance where the bandage is tied in this way sometimes.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the extremity of the pulse below, which is inserted into the buttock, should be subtle (not exposed) like a lion, subtly; and on one side of the thigh there are two channels, and on the other side one channel, and the width of the channel is according to the size of the roots and thus a small one.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the bandage in which the medicines of bladder of beast or of sheep's skin are wrapped, and the width of it should be a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be pierced for many channels, just as it is revolving; and if the space which is between the channels is very large according to the finger.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those channels a strong thread of crude fiber which is of two fibers, or around them; and adjust it on the bandage; and when it is wrapped on the patient, it should be stretched at the head of the cross between two distinct and strongly constricted points, and then cross it on each channel: The quality of crossing on each channel is that you fill the bandage with medicine, which should be warmed according to the quantity of the tolerance of the patient; and beware that it is not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then the patient should be resupinated on his back, and elevate his legs up and place one body part above him or a lantern; and then apply the extremity of the cautery with oil or album of water or mucilage of fenugrec or of similar things; and then insert that into the buttock to facilitate, and then the minister takes the bandage and extracts it with two fingers and seven times with vehemence until it is evacuated from the intestine as much as is in the Christ's cross; and then remove the Christ's cross and the patient raises his legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces it to evacuation, hold it as much as you can; and if he sleeps through the whole night, it is more certain in its juvenation.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	More so if you cross it on the patients of solution of belly and evacuation of the intestine, then you iterate the cautery until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the buttock there are morbid or putrid abscesses, then the Christ's cross should be subtle and gentle, one of those Christ's crosses with which children are treated.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Of the treatment of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already said in the division of the treatment of wounds what is convenient to the book, and I have said thus the treatment of those with mother and medicines according to the complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	So I say that wounds are diversified according to what they are made of and according to the place on which they occur.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes why many wounds are made of such things as the blow of a stone, or incision of space, or percussion with a lance, or a fist, or a dagger, or similar to those of many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	More wounds that are in the places of the body such as a wound which falls on the head, or the neck, or the feet, or the belly, or the thigh, and similar to those of the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I have recommended the treatment of some wounds because it pauses that reasoning and rule about the other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with simple head wounds, because the remembrance of the composed will come to the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	So I say that when simple head wounds occur and it is not a fracture, then consider: if it is from a blow of a stone or similar, and has already torn the scalp so much and it is a great wound and there are fears about that patient having an apostema cut, then you should remove the cephalic suppuration as soon as possible, and do not delay; and extract according to the quantity of the virtue of the blood if there is no prohibitive cause for phlebotomy, especially if the blood that is extracted from the wound is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And it should be phlebotomy of the opposite part of the wounded area; and beware of the patient's replenishment and of wine and of thick broths.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	More so if from the minute you prohibit some cause, then it should be diminished of the wine and not approached to meat nor to wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And stop on the wound, if it occurs with apostema cut, then inject olive oil or wine in which there is stipptic.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	Most surely it is secure to apply a warm poultice, then pause on the affected area, if it recently happened in the last six hours and the air has not changed that powdery thing which you recommend to apply small.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that powdery thing, then pause on the swollen gums until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	Most surely if the wound is large or is from a spacious and similar injury, and not just the lips of it are adjusted for pustules, then adjust them with a suture according to how you recommend for the suture of theirs.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	Most surely if the wound has discovered the bone and pen, and it does not retain its own except for a small suspensor, then incise that and apply careful cure to the wound with medicines and restore the flesh properly in place of cartilage, and command the patient to be moderate in victuals in which there is grossness: caps and form a coil and similar to theirs, until it is composed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find putrid flesh in the cartilage and it does not adhere to the bone, then you incise all that rottenness and remove it, and apply careful cure to it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	Most surely if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which flows potent blood that can come out, and it is not abscessed by medicines, then you inquire about the artery, and if you find that one unincised, then you incise that with a spatula, or lance it; and if necessary to provoke what we have said does not congregate, then you cauterize until the blood is abscessed.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then the cause of theirs is lighter; thus you dust over those with that powder, because consolidated there beneath so that the air does not change them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take oil of iris one part, dragon's blood two parts, and cinnamon three parts not extinct; let it be all well trituated and crushed, and of that let the wound be filled, and let it be constricted by good constriction until it be above the aching, and let it be coagulated with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then strengthen that beneath with poults and lift it, and do not remove it while it is thus that it is not applied, because it is not eradicated from there by the medicine until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And some old woman makes that solo remedy, when it is not to you in presence of iris and dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And already this method of operation is suitable for large wounds when it is convenient to pause over them and they are straight, and these recent wounds are with their own blood, which the air has not altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is in summer time, then it is not intended for the position of this powder, most surely cure those with what we have said, thus you pause over those swollen gums digested, or you pause over those pustules of flour of the ordinary water and honey until they get purification; and apply careful cure to those with another careful cure until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	Most surely if you find a fracture wound in the bone, and it is small, then you extract that with gestures.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And you direct the cure of fractures of the head in what is coming.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the wounds of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	Most surely if the wound occurs on the neck, then it is not in its difference from medication, and between the wound of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	Most surely if the nerve of the neck is incised or artery, then if it is nerve, it is not in its engendering but that careful cure be avoided with what makes vehement stipulation, thus as zinc and zeal that it is veteran and similar to theirs because no others are like those nerves and contradict that.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not pause over the wound for any total cause of all freshness, because the substance of the nerves is fresh and their continuation is with the brain, which is the pus that comes from all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is that which is cured by light medicines, thus as it is caused by washing with warm water, some veiled infusion in oil of roses or non-roses, and thucia when it is washed with warm water and the other small pains are minimized according to this manner, and swollen gums are humbled.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	Most surely if the wound is large, then administer suture, or sew up the lips of it, and apply careful cure to that with poults until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	Most surely if the wound is deep or occurs in the place of putrid matter, then pierce that at the most depressed location.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	Most surely if in the wound an artery is incised and a flow of blood is obtained, then separate or dry that, or lance it, or cauterize it if necessary to provoke what we have said.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	Most surely if you have incised the vertebrae of the neck or all, and so saved the veins of the neck, then you adjust the lips of the cartilage with a suture over the cane of the neck and do not touch that; afterwards equalize that and reduce it to its natural figure, and apply careful strengthening to that with decent structure, and lift that for several days; and apply careful cure to that with swollen gums in which there is stipulation and excitement until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	If the plague has already entered the patient's bone to make an impression, then perceive it, and if there is a fragment of bone, extract all that you can from them; and what you do not apprehend, let it remain within so that the plague does not spread, and separate and remove the affected part from the healthy one.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the plague is recent, then powder over it with the powder that you have recommended.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	If the plague has made a fistula, then cure it with what is remembered to bring remedy soon to the sick head.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the ulcers of the neck or of similar [appearance] which are made between the spine and are made in the scapula or in the ribcage or in the lance or in similar [places].
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a percussion of the ribcage or of the lance, and sometimes of its depth, then consider that if the plague has taken possession of the patient's body, then you know that the plague is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the plague is recent in the sick blood, then you pause in it from the first hour powder, and do not strenuous that which is not the retained blood in the depth of it and returns to the heart and revives the patient, rather pause in it an attractive engagement, and deliver those two weighed doses a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the engagement is not present to you, then pause at the orifice of the plague, which collects much from the humidity; and make that the patient sleeps on the plague so that it may run what is in it, adjusted.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	If the plague has passed three days or more and does not affect the patient with spasm or tremor of bad heart nor constriction of wings, and sometimes the other good dispositions of it, then you know that the plague is saved; and then cure it with warm compresses and another curative treatment until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	If the healing of it is exhausted, and already all time is opened, then you know that a fistula has been made; cure it therefore for the sick head.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the plague is by incision of scapula or of ribcage, and is simple on the surface of the foot or of the back, then cure it with what is preceded by suture, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	If it has made an impression on the bone, and its roots are implanted, then you twist the plague and cut to extract those roots, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If they are not separated, then let them remain within so that the plague does not spread, for the extraction of them is alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other plagues occurring in the other members, the juvenation in cure is the juvenation of what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the plagues of the belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition that affects the belly is either great, or small, or middling.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great ulcers that have taken possession of the intestine or nerves of the intestine, because it is made by their introjection and the suture of them must be more vehement and more subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And small disruption is made difficult by another manner, and thus it is that the reduction of them is more difficult, if you do not take care of their introjection at the right place immediately, because it becomes thickened and is grossly engrossed, for which the instrument of it is made difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And thus the better disruption is middling, because in that it is not difficult to reduce the intestine, as it is difficult in the two species mentioned above.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And you know that the suture of the belly is according to four manners, but two sutures are common that are convenient for sutures of the other plagues of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other proper sutures communicate with the other plagues, but especially so many are proper in the suture of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to you each exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	So I say that when the plague is small and it has some cause in the intestine for that, and it is made difficult to reduce it, then it is in one of two manners: either by smallness of the disruption as we have said, or when the intestine is come to inflammation from the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And so when it is thus, then you should scald that in this way that you submerge a sponge hot and dripping with humid water alone, or that you cook in water squinant, and cyperum, and spic, and embroques with that in the intestine until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And some taken possession make it visible in which it has stipulated, and it is better than water alone in resolving the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And so when you see the inflammation is resolved, then you humidify the intestine with water in which is cooked altaea and malvas, because for that it is alleviated the instrument of it with few causes.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	If the instrument of it is excused from this cure, then you separate the disruption with a small instrument in which are implanted emollients.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is better, when it is probable that there is no infection, and there is no occupation to occupy or delay necessary relief.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	From the instrument, see its shape in it:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of the sharp-edged torcha, and the other not-acute, and the subtle extremity, and it should not be in the subtlety of the spatula, unless it becomes obtuse at a few points.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And then when the plague is amplified and goes outside the intestine, then it's necessary that its reduction be according to the form of the natural location, in its own proper place, if it's possible about that, because better is.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	Moreover when the disruption is wide, and it's in the lower part of the belly, then it's necessary that you place the patient on their back, and stop their legs besides their head; and if it's in the upper part of the belly, then you stop their head and the chest besides the parts below.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, then pause your attention and consideration at all times so that the part where the plague is may be more open than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus it's necessary that you administer this in great plagues and in minor plagues.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small plagues, pause that which is at your preparation, and make sure that the minister is between your most prepared hands, which hold the entire disruption in its mouth and adjust its lips, and then discover from that to him who knows the suture of some other cause.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suture: one that takes the needle, or counts the threads according to the quantity of the amplitude of the plague; and then release the extremity of the disruption from the ring finger, and stretch the thread once, without you putting faith in the two extremities of the codeina, both extremities of the cipher that is below the codeina of the divided parts, until you make it penetrate that part; and you have already added both extremities of the codeina and both extremities of the cipher, and so form four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then stretch with double faith in the circuit of the needle, and some divided parts together, and then add both lips to the plague for decent addition; and then release the grossness of the finger and fix another needle there, and then tie it with double faith as if it were the first needle; and do not cease from doing that if it is necessary among the needles until you complete all the contraction of the plague.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And thus the minor needles are between roughness and subtlety, because the subtle needles hardly ever incidentally touch the flesh; and the large ones are of difficult entry into the codeina, and therefore it's necessary that they be minor in subtlety and grossness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it's not necessary that the needle be fixed in both extremities of the codeina nearby, so that the flesh is not incidentally touched and that the plague does not open before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And there are no prolonged sutures because the plague should not be prohibited from consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then insert the extremities of the needles so that they do not let the patient deviate from their proper dormier; and pause over the suture with pulverized expanses of entire parts, which hold the extremities of the needles; and release them until you know that the plague is already consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these species of suture with needles in this way are more convenient in small plagues, because they have need of a suture of one needle or two or around those.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	Moreover the second suture is communal: and it's that you administer a suture of the four extremities, of the codeina and both extremities of the cipher, in one way, with a needle in which faith is enveloped in subtlety and grossness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when the needle has penetrated these four extremities, return the needle to that same part of which it began, so that the faith retracts from the most sublime part to the plague, so that the suture is according to the suture of a taut thread in which the threads are strongly tightened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And pause between each suture the quantity of the grossness of the smallest finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture is known to men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And in this suture I cured the plague that had afflicted a man in his belly, which had been plagued by a cut, and it was the disruption of the major plague of one palm, and it was situated around two palms from the intestine of the middle place, and it was the disruption in the middle of the limb; and then I cured it after the intestine had been outside the plague for 23 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the plague was consolidated in the space of 15 days or around, and I cured it and it was healed; and then I visited for many years, and it was converted into its proper dispositions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other doctors have judged that it is not a healthy place; and by miraculous focal point, because you do not cure anything that has been wounded, because it was in a place where the wound was not treated or any medicine, but rather the plague was hidden for many days, and continually ablution with warm water inside, so that it may be healthy.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	Perhaps you direct two special types of proper suturing according to the narration of Pareula.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you begin with suturing of the cord, and you insert a needle from the front part to the back part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And thus when the needle penetrates into the cord and in that moment it goes straight according to rectitude and in the length of the whole body, and it reaches the extremity of the ciphac where you have inserted the needle; and make it penetrate from one extremity to the other, from the back part to the front part, in the other extremity of the miyat.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And then when you have made it penetrate, then make it penetrate another way in that same extremity of the miyat from the front part to the back part; and it reaches the extremity of the ciphac which is in this side, and make the needle penetrate from one extremity to the other, from the back part to the front part.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make it penetrate again in that same penetration, which you do by penetrating into the ciphac in the extremity of the mirror, which is inside, so that all of it penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then begin from this same side and sew up that extremity which is of the ciphac on the other side, and withdraw the needle from the cord that penetrated, and then return it to its place in the cord, and so the extremity of the ciphac which is on the other side is in this same extremity of the mirror; and withdraw it from the cord which belongs to it.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And make one way and another, and make one way returning to another way until you collect all that is before, according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this manner of suturing is that you collect a suturing of pellicles in which you collect the skin, and thus you collect the ciphac one way from the part of the extremity of the cord, and that you leave another way until it is complete.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	Perhaps the second special type of proper suturing that Gualia recommends, and this is concerning the serum of it and for its recommendation, it is that you collect according to similarity in which some doctors collect it, and thus they add all part to its corresponding part convenient by nature; and they apply the extremity of another to the mirror's extremity to the other extremity, and that is done according to what you have recommended.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	That you fix the needle in the extremity of the mirror at your own part from the front, and make it penetrate to the back part in that sole, and leave two extremities of the ciphac; and then return the needle and make it penetrate from the front to the back in two extremities of the ciphac.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then return those circles, and make penetrate certain ones from the back part to the front part in two extremities of the mirror other than those that are on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suturing is better than the common ligature, and it is a suturing of which I previously mentioned remembering.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the serum of Gualia.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And perhaps the doctors said that a suturing of the belly is rectified with two needles, so it is that you insert in these a certain fidelity, and begin with an introduction of needle from what is yours, and make it penetrate into the other side according to the suturing of those who sew up the intestines together.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And you know that when disruption is in a middle location of the belly, then the suturing of it is more difficult than in other locations of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	Perhaps the judgment of medical treatment of plague is a judgment of the other plagues.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	Which cause is because when you consider the recent plague similar to the holy blood that it alters, and reduces the intestine and collects it and adapts it decently, then pause over that incarnative powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then pause over those doctors who are present until they make a hard and strong remedy, and consolidate ciphac and mirror; and then cure it thus as is the cure of the other plagues until it is healthy.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	Perhaps if you are not present with the medicines, then pause over that so much, because it begins to take a long time, and ablute many times a day, thus as you and teach, until it is healthy, because you do not need other medical treatment in many dispositional motives when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	Perhaps if you fear that the plague communicates with the principal members, then it is necessary that you submerge the woolen thread in oil of tempered quality, or in rose oil, and pause it in the circuit of the places that are between the angles and leave the essences.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	If there is pain or putrefaction in the intestines, because many empty veins have ended there, then crystallize that bitter medicine with a sharp pointed instrument, and it will be more effective if the perforation is made in the intestine and it makes an penetrating exit into its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	You know that the one that is of the large intestine is to remove more easily than the one that is in the subtle intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the intestine which is called "gizzard" does not receive healing of a wound that falls into it from everywhere; and this is due to the great multitude of veins that are in it, and due to its magnitude, and due to the subtlety of its body, and due to its proximity to the nature of nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	Perhaps what proceeds from the wound is the fabric, and you will achieve that remedy, reduce it according to your correct method in which you reduce the intestines in a gathered way.
