E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, incise that corrupted joint, and cover the bone where it continues from the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in its reason but rather in the vein.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the chest or foot, it is very difficult; however, cover so that you inquire into the corruption in whatever manner it appears to you, and that you open it, and remove it according to each disposition which is possible for you, and also with caution lest it be rectified to you, when it does not make you contrary veins or nerves.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know what the incisions and closures are to incise these bones, according to the situation of the bones, and their preparation, and their thickness, and their subtlety and greatness and smallness, and their hardness and rarity; so that you prepare for all kinds of operations and convenient instruments for that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that this operation depends on you regarding the type of instrument which you need; when you are great study and long and knowledgeable about the ways of this art, and testimony of ways of illnesses, because then you have them for your measures that are convenient to all instruments for all illnesses.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And you will find in the end of this chapter the number of instruments which you will pause with, as I have simplified them, and those that proceed to your prohibition, which you will experiment on the others.
Forma de serra:	Form of closure:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another closure:
Forma de autra serra:	Form of another closure: (no change, same translation)
Forma de autra serra gran:	Form of a large closure:
Forma de ray:	Form of a radius:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Be the head of this radius according to the form of the head of a star-shaped claw, and the points of it are according to the form of the points of a steadfast instrument.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not suitable unless you have that instrument confected with the heads of the joints when they are corrupted, or it is a large wide mouth.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Form of a larger razor of the others:
Forma de razori menor:	Form of a smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Form of a broad razor:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Form of another closure made decently: it is made with an arched curve of the foot above and the acuity of iron, and the member of the foot below is made decently.
Forma de lu:	Form of it:
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Form of a razor in which it has been concaved:
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Form of another subtle razor:
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Form of another razor with a curved extremity:
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Form of a small razor resembling a lancet:
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Form of an incisor with which you incise the bones:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Form of another smaller incisor:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Form of another incisor; this resembles a radius, and the extremity of it is like a closure, and it is exhibited in many places in the ratio of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Form of a radius which is suitable for a ratio of that which is perforated through the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extremity is triangular and of sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of iron from India, and similarly you cover all the causes that we have said about razors and incisors and closures.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision extremities and of the closure of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities are weakened either by an intrinsic cause or by an extrinsic cause, or as you have medicated that corruption with a cure of those medicines and the cure does not concur, or sometimes the corruption becomes so bad that it deviates from the member which is not perceived by any cause, then it covers that you incise that member until it reaches the corrupted area, so that the evil may evacuate through death or malice which is greater defilement of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that one to which it happens, is that the member becomes black until it is understood that fire has already consumed it, or it withers away near the blackness until the withering reaches that member and takes all the body; and thus you will know the incision of that one.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly if it is a cause of corruption from venomous causes, such as the sting of a scorpion or of a viper or of a rattlesnake and of similar things.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	If the corruption or percussion is in the extremity of the finger, then you should incise the finger and do not leave space for the corruption to spread to the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	Similarly, if it reaches the hand, then you should incise that at the root of the forearm, and do not leave space for the corruption to spread so that it takes hold in the forearm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you want to evacuate it, then incise the arm up to the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes beyond and surrounds the elbow, then in that case it is the death of the patient; and to administer another cause for cure is a quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	Similarly, it happens to the foot when corruption reaches the toe of the foot, then you should incise that up to one of the nails.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold on the edge of the foot, then you should incise the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it reaches into the ankle, then you should incise the leg up to the joint of the ankle.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread over the ankle, then in that case it is not a cure but rather a dismissal, and leaving the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the method of incising the limb or of sawing it is that you stretch a ligament in the part below where you want to incise, and stretch another ligament over the area; and extend the minister a ligament to the parts below, and extend the minister another ligament upwards; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments in this way until all the flesh is discovered; and then it is incised or sawed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And take care that it is placed far from the edge of all parts so that it does not touch the area, and that the patient's lesion is adjusted and aposteme is cautious.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if there is a flow of blood when operating, then you should cauterize the area carefully, or stop the bleeding with some powders that restrain the blood; and then return to your medication until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the wounded limb with a ligament at a convenient point, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you that which happens to a man in his sick foot, this kind of accident which you and I have recommended, which is because the black humour in the sick foot was assembled with combustion of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption happens primarily in the sick toe until it reaches the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepares himself for such pus that he wants to cure the limb with the vehemence of that which removes pain and discomfort, and incises that foot up to the joint, and fire heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	A long time ago, that same corruption happened in the finger of my hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it came to me, and I had to perform a repetition of that superfetation on the hand of my medicines, then the mundification of the body; and it does not repeat the superfetation and begins to move to the other finger until it reaches the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And they asked me to incise the hand of that, and I did not want to do anything expecting a repetition of that superfetation, and perhaps it would have been better to have avoided the incision of the hand of death, because the virtue of the patient was on the point of collapse.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he despaired of me, he returned to his land and it happened to me that that man prepared and incised his entire hand, and was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this narration except to be an aid regarding what is said about this disease, and that it may be significant for which it is signified and according to which it is operated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the care of joints and the quality of cleansing with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in certain carnal members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it forms a collection of pus, and then it breaks and perforates, and the pus flows out, and the area around which it was like a vessel, and the channel that is above it like a subtle drain, and it does not reach the underlying corruption, and it does not impinge on the bone or nerve or ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not named fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But perhaps if the space is prolonged until the corruption penetrates into certain members, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure of it is that you incise the entire channel in this way as it is revolved, and mainly when it is subtily drained and made to flow like a drain, and confirms that it does not adhere to the area because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you think that the channel adheres and that corruption has not been achieved by underlying consequence, and in the channel there has been a passage of carrion, then you should cure it with a cleansing.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that I consider the sinus, and then if it is large, and the arm which you have of fetid odor, then cleanse it with Egyptian medicine which is of oil and vinegar and zinc, receiving equal parts, and adjust them in a vessel, and apply them over the fire until the medicine becomes red and reaches the specific of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And you take the water that is necessary and dissolve it in a warm liquid and honey; and cleanse the sinus, and strengthen the orifice of the intestine, and leave the medicine in it for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	Then extract that liquid with precision; and make it for several days until the sinus is purified and the putridity is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And some vegetables are cleansed with warm water of cinder, when you do not have this medication present; and it is that you take the cinder of vitriol, and put it over the water; and then take that and cleanse it in her until you confirm that the sinus is cleared at that time.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient has no tolerance to the Egyptian medication or the water of cinder, then cleanse it with warm water and honey mixed with ziniar trissat, and cleanse it with warm water and honey mixed, because the property of honey is that it purifies and cleans, and the warm water makes the sinus adhere, and it increases when the warm water has overflowed with moisture and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you make that liquid with some vegetables and you confirm that the sinus is already cleared, then cleanse it with water that makes the flesh of the body soft.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is that you take the juice of dyafinicon and dissolve it in oil of rozat and warm stipptic; or that you cleanse with some medicines and other juices that have the properties which I have already written about in the treatise on juices.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is straitened in which the tube of the syringe is not received, then you amplify that liquid by adding a little ferrum petit at a time, and pause in the wrapped calyx covered with Egyptian juice or basilicon juice until it is amplified.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the orifice is wide, then you add the lips of the liquid to the suture and leave the quantity in which the syringe injects its additions.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of the intestine where the arm is elevated to the upper parts, then dry it in the lower place where it is in the body so that the arm may flow until below, because when the arm is constricted at the entrance of the sinus, the flesh will be engendered in the body.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinus until the lower place of the bone according to your wishes, then you should prepare the member with preparation so that the arm may flow more easily according to what is apparent to you and so that no cause of the arm is retained.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidative medicines that are placed conveniently over the sinus, according to what you want to extend those over the cloth of linen.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth is of such great quantity that it makes communication with all the sinus; and then insert the forks in the right orifice of the sinus through an ample tube, a little; and then extend over another cloth of linen with the Egyptian juices according to the quantity of the tube, and pause it there for a long position of the orifice of the sinus so that the flow of the arm is alleviated and does not obstruct the great cloth except for some days, one vegetable.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	That which is over the orifice of the sinus, which remains there for a whole hour so that it flows correctly into the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so you know if the liquid that flows from the arm is a lot or a little, whether it is digested or not digested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And then you consider the place of that sinus, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if it is in an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your medication is prolonged in such a manner, and you see the matter that is poured over the orifice of the sinus already adheres, or takes proper adhesion, then you may detach it on the third day, and when you detach the plague, then change the cloth for another and renew the juice.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if the sinus has a subtle and fine virus, then do not despair of its adhesion, because the health of the body is proper, because some homes are in those which slow down the generation of flesh in the aforementioned plagues, and of those which are made contrary to it.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if the sinus for many days has an indigested arm, then you know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and is a prolonged cause, then you adjust in the desiccation of the medicines, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they are dried also like juice of dyafinicon, when it is in an adjusted superfluous addition of zegi.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last medicine which is curative, is that you take juice of dyafinicon and dissolve it in oil of rozat, and put it on the arm with an antique vessel in its substance, and then confirm that liquid, and use it.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And thus it is similar in that action, when there is no arm, juice of dyafinicon, honey which is cooked until it is thickened, and use it; or take mirra and aloen and grind them, and sprinkle all over the honey which is under the focus, and then spread that liquid over the cloth and strengthen it over the sinus; and thus spread that liquid over the honey which has been cooked until it is thickened, and sprinkle over the cloth and strengthen it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And certain evacuations are administered in the long Aristological method and celestial roots (and it is celestial roots) and farina of errors and centaurea, and use of those simple or adjusted, trituration and pulverization on the honey that has been recommended; and its juice.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged, and it is not healed by this cure, then you know that the corruption is in the praecordium of the patient, and already there is an inquiry into the bones or other hard members or ligaments; then you will treat with a fistular cure, as it is said below.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the treatment of painful and worn-out nails and of incised fingers added to the section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Painful nails are an aposteme which often arises from the nail of the hand or foot, and it often occurs in other fingers, and as it is prolonged and its treatment is less attended to, or it becomes apostematous from the post-aposteme caution, or it becomes corrupted, and it throws a branch within that corrodes the root of the nail, and it corrupts all of it, and it perverts its corruption to the bone within, so that it is at the fetid odor, and the extremity of the finger is affected, and the color of it is darkened.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And then when you have that water which we have spoken of in the division and it does not conduce to your cure, then it is necessary that you remove all the superfluousness that has grown from the nail and return to cauterize the wound with that water, because a cautery made in this way is very beneficial.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Moreover if the bone is healthy and the nail is sound, and the additions of the nail are already comprehending the flesh in the divided parts, and they begin to sting and pierce that, then it is necessary that you pause subtly under the angle of the nail that pierces the flesh, and you press upon it and incise that flesh to facilitate, and you put on what remains of the flesh of the corrosive medicines burning within so that it may be totally removed; and you return to cure that wounded area until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	Moreover if the corruption has already taken hold in the bone, then it is necessary that you incise the bone itself and extract it, for no time will it be healed while it is in the corrupted bone.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corrosion and corruption are in the finger, then you incise it in one of the nodes according to the premise of its reminiscence, and you return to cure it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	Moreover if the nail has received percussion or attrition, and has become painful with vehement pain, then it is necessary that you begin to soften the patient, and return to cut the nail with a spatula-like instrument with a transverse section above the joint, and beware that the section does not penetrate into the flesh which is under the nail, lest you cause the patient vehement pain, and it will be the cause of the superfluous nativity of the adjusted flesh in the location; and return to treat that location with water that alleviates the pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	Moreover, it is adjusted, which is born in the marrow of some men, for they are entirely fleshy, and entirely in their bones, or entirely in their nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born in the root of the joint, or it is the nativity of them in certain nodes of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	Moreover, that which is born in certain nodes of the finger does not become evil, and that which is born in the joints is entirely bad.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those that are fleshy growths, the section is easier, and it is necessary that you incise that with a broad spatula-like instrument.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	Moreover, of that which is born in the root of the joint, the cure is difficult; and therefore beware of its abscession.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Moreover, in that which is born on the fingers with nodes, it is necessary that you incise at the beginning the flesh of it with a round incision into the bone, and return to close with one of those convenient serrations adapted to that, and return to cure it until it is healed.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	Moreover, consolidation occurs which adheres to the fingers among the evacuated joints or by nativity of the man who is thus, or by consolidation of the wound or by combustion of fire, or by semblance, therefore it is necessary that you section that consolidation until the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And return to pause between the drapes of the inflamed joints with rose oil so that they are not consolidated too quickly, and separate them among themselves, or pause among them a thin layer of lead until it is consolidated according to what is necessary.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly if consolidation occurs in certain fingers at the palm, then you section that consolidation according to how it is prepared and adapts to the figure of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of incision of veins, they are variable.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins are variable, and they are enveloped by gross superfluous melancholic fluids which come from the members of the body, and the greatest advent occurs in their hollows, and they are augmented in the hollows of the wanderers and laborers and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then you should administer purging of the body from black bile by evacuating strongly, and also bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment of their iron instruments is according to two methods: one is that they should be inserted and the black blood should be attracted, and the other method is that the vein should be raised and all the blood should be extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The sectioning of it is according to this method: start by introducing the leg in hot water so that the thick blood is resolved, which is foul-smelling from the leg, and then stretch the leg of the patient towards the upper part of the thigh into a band, and then section the vein in one place, or two, or three with ample sectioning, and then raise the black blood to the highest part of the thigh above the knee, and from there down, until the quantity of blood that you want is evacuated, and which will tolerate the virtue of the patient.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then leave it there, and command him to abstain from food that generates black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And continue the treatment by phlebotomy when the veins are full and it is noticed to be beneficial to the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	The elevation of them is according to this method: you raise the patient's leg, if there are many pimples on it, and then place it in a bath and introduce the leg into hot water until it becomes red and the veins become exuberant; or it should be exercised with strong exercise, if a bath is not present at your location, until the member becomes warm.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then section the cord at the right of the vein for sectioning in the groin or in the back of the patient's knee, or at the lowest part of the patient's ankle.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then uncover the cord with an incision and excavate the vein from all parts until it appears to the sense, and it is necessary for the patient's appearance, which sometimes declines into blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then, when you evacuate from the cord, you will see that white thing which is a vein.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then place it below the vein until it is elevated and removed from the cord, and suspend it in an incision or open wound.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then section another section in that section for three fingers, and then excavate the cord from the part below the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then raise it and insert it into the back section of the ankle, and then extract it and raise it until it is evacuated through the second section, and then extract it from the section that is above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do it until you extract it from the section that is above or outside of all the sections, until everything is evacuated; and then insert it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you cannot extract and elevate it, then introduce a strong double-edged needle and tie it up and extract it, or introduce it below the vein and rotate your hand to all parts until it is grasped.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful that it is not inserted; because if it is broken, it will be difficult for you to elevate it much and it will come back over the patient through that injury.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when everything is evacuated, then pause over the place of the wounded area submerged in wine and oil rose and oil not-rose, and cure it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the life is contrary and has twisted around which it is enveloped in the parts, and it is not according to rectitude as we have said, then you should confess about that to the whole part of twisting of it and the places of its envelopment, and then suspend it in an incision until it elevates everything.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful with your sectioning that you do not insert the vein and that you do not harm it, because it will be difficult for you to elevate it; and preserve your prudence in that.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Method of inserting into the place where life is sectioned:
Forma de unci orp:	Method of an incision or wound:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not to be inserted hastily like that into the incision or wound, nor is it of acute extremity so that it does not harm the vein; and it is of gross flexibility, because if it were subtle, it would insert the vein by its subtlety; having excess in superfluous grossness like that which we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	On the extraction of the veins of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs on hot lands, just like in the land of Arabs and in the hot and dry lands of India with little fertility, where there are no herbs or plants.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is generated strongly in other places of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the condition of it is of putrefaction that you see below the cord, just like venomous snakes and worms and scorpions and worms generating between the cord and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the suspicion of the advent of it is of this vein that causes inflammation vehemently in the leg; and then the place becomes blistered; and then the vein starts to issue from the place of that blistering, which seems to be rooted like a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And then it appears from there to the extremity, then cover it with a piece of lead weighing one dram, or two drams, and place that suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And many times, with the eyes of the alcuna cause in the foreparts, wrap it in lead and apply that.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the motion is prolonged, then you insert a part of it and wrap the remaining; and do not insert that with too much force until it is fully settled, because if you insert it with force, it becomes counterproductive and enters into the flesh, causing apostema and putridity in the area and ulceration badly.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Because it is necessary that it be treated gently and be extracted little by little, until it is fully removed from the back of it and no remaining cause stays in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein it is extracted in some men who are in their longitude of 5 palms and of toes, and already I have received one of 20 palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is inserted at the time of its medication, then introduce the ray into the channel of it and perforate that long channel in the body, until all that is in the matter is evacuated, and administer putrefaction to the area for several days with medications; and then cure it for the cure of apostemas.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.
