E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And of the accidents of theirs when it is broken in the middle of it, it declines into the internal parts and comes together with great pain, and difficulty in walking, and stumbling, and strong weakness, and vomiting blood; and it is declared in the cavity of the broken bone and does not hide from the sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of it is that the patient is resupinated over their own back, and placed between their shoulders a small cushion; and then pressed on their muscles, and adjusted their ribs with two rib-counters, and subtly worked on the operation of it and in the equation according to all manner that is possible and that converges to it, until the figure of the bone returns as it was.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	And then pause on the plaster and stop and pause above the subtle star of table of sauce or of calyx and of their similar levitation, since you envelop it in cloth; and then subtly work on binding that above the broken bone so it is not moved; and go with a bond according to what is returned to the back some vegetables, and strengthen it with decent constriction; and then consider the bond at all hours, and when it is mollified, strengthen it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if it is necessary to provoke the dislocation of that which causes corrosion or bruising, or pain, or apostema that comes together in the place, then you cut and dissect that and eradicate the plaster and rectify what comes together for the manner of cure of theirs; and then reduce the plaster, if it returns to its face; and adjust its structure until it is healthy.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of the ribs when they are cracked.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	You know that a fracture of the ribs does not happen except in gross places that follow the back; and of the extremities of theirs from the part above they do not come together with contraction but for what is cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And the knowledge of it is not hidden from the sensation, because of the inquiry of it with the fingers.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration is thus that it unites the fracture with the fingers according to the possible manner, until it is united as it was, and then plasters and strengthens the broken bone with star, if it needs that.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	If the fracture of the ribs is declining towards the internal parts, then it brings violent pain and puncture, just as puncture brings to one who has experienced pleasure, and for this reason the bones are placed in the wrapping; and it brings difficulty to handle, and thus, and vomiting of much blood; and this is difficult to cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And already the Antics are engineered in that limb with many ingenious devices.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And they say that it is necessary to pause the veins of the patient that generate inflammation and windiness, so that the belly may be inflated and extended, and the fracture may be driven towards the outer parts.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	We have avoided this so that it does not cause a light fever to generate a hot abscess, if it does not succeed; and if it does succeed, then it helps with that.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	And they say that some of them should be paused under the wind and then sucked with a strong fortitude; and it seems like a rationalization, but I, emperor, am afraid that the wind will attract the excesses to the place of debilitation.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	And they say that some of them: it is necessary for the place to be covered with wool that has been submerged in hot oil, and powders are paused between the ribs until it is filled, which is the binding wound when enveloping according to the second intention; and then the patient is cured with a cure of pleasing wind and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if it causes violent constraint to the patient who does not suffer, and the bones do puncture with a sharp point, I think about the patient, then it is necessary to bind above the place, uncovering the broken rib, and then pause over that instrument that preserves the cipher, the remembrance of which is preceding, and that inserts the bones in a facilitated way, and extracts that.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And then adjust the two lips of the wound, if it is large, with a dressing, and cure that with emplasters until it is healed.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if it succeeds in generating an abscess, then you touch and pour powders into rose oil and pause over the place, and the patient is cured with that which is necessary for the abscess to be generated.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And it is resurrected upon the mattress on which he sleeps, until it is healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of fractures of the spine and neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Some veiled injuries reveal fractures in the neck bones, and similarly they attribute to their own attribution, and likewise to the spine of the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And when it succeeds in revealing some of them and you want to know if it will be healed or not, then consider, because if the sieves are more mollified and stupefied and dead and cannot be extended nor strengthened, and when they constrain with lesions or punctures or needles and do not feel pain, then you know that it is not healed, and in the same disposition it is mortal.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if it does that and feels constraint with lesions or punctures, then you know that the nut of the bone is saved and that the patient will recover with a cure.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see the spine of the neck similar to that and you want to know if it will be healed or not, then consider its feet.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	Then if you see that it is mollified, it succeeds in revealing to those who have fallen into the masses, and then when you sit upon the sick back, you feel windiness and evacuation of their will, and some veiled injuries are resurrected upon the sick back and want to urinate but cannot, then you know that it is mortal, and therefore do not struggle with its cure.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	But if it does not succeed in revealing any cause of those, the cause is worse and more feverish.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the cure of it is that you perform a sedation of the hot abscess that pauses over the atrited spine with rose oil sol, or with mugwort of Houssay's mixture; pause over that some veiled injuries during the day until the hot abscess is sedated.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And then pause one of the comforting and existent emplasters, and strengthen over that with a liament; and command the patient to use rest and tranquility and not to sleep on the affected part where it hurts until it is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	And if it succeeds in giving the atrition of the satirical bones or some cause that has been separated from it, then it is necessary to succeed over the code and to remove that bone; and then adjust the two lips of the wound, with a suture if it is large; and then cure that with an encarnation of the enguentz, until it is healed.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	But if the bone of the fingers is broken, and it is the end of the rib, then it is necessary that you insert the finger in the left hand in the back, and that you join the broken bone in the other hand according to what is possible for second equilibrium; and then pause over the emplaster and astelha, if you need those, and then strengthen that.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel broken satirical bones in it, then you finish over that, and remove that, and cure the wound with the cure that is preceding until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Head chapter.
De restauracio de la ancha.	About the restoration of the narrow passage.
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the narrow passages are so fractured, and if they are fractured, then the breakage is only communicated to the extremities of those and are inserted in the length and decline towards the internal parts; and it causes a bad pain in the place and puncture, and the leg is stunned when it is fractured.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of it is that you extend your hand over that entrance which is above the fracture, whose shape is that of it.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is in the extremity of it alone, then you straighten that according to how it appears to you by equalizing the entrance that it may be assembled to its natural figure.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	But if the fracture is in the loin or already declines towards the lower parts, then you make the patient lie on their back with their belly exposed so that it may be prepared for your restoration of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And then when you have straightened it, place a plaster cast on it, and also place a splint of wood or of cane, and bind by stricture so that there is no point of fracture nor movement of the splint.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And fill the concavity with water so that it takes the shape according to equality, and command the patient to sleep on their back or on their side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	But if there is a hot abscess, then cease the extension of it and its restoration until the hot abscess is settled, and place water on it that settles according to what has been said; and then return to its restoration, and bind thus with a cover.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if they are in the affected bones or are communicated, then you treat them.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter eleven.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	About the restoration of the fracture of the helper.
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The helper is that which is between the shoulder blade and the head of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is fractured, then the restoration of it is in one of two manners, one of which is that you take a wooden plate instead of a thick groove according to this form.
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And tie it with two extremities of two ligaments, and then it is suspended from the elevated place.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	And follow the patient onto a seat; and then put the broken arm on the wood until it reaches the tip of it in the middle place where it is annexed to the curvature of the wood.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And then suspend it above some heavy cause or the minister extends it to the lower parts; and then the doctor says that the fracture is in its proper place, until the fracture returns according to what is convenient.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And the other manner is that the patient is resupinated on their back and suspends the hand of the neck with a ligament; and then command two ministers that one of them holds what is above the fracture in its proper place; and the other holds it below; and each of them extends to their part.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	And if you want the extension to be stronger, then bind above the fracture with a ligament and above that with another ligament, and each of the two ministers extends to their two parts.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And then if the fracture is near the extremity of the muscle, then it is convenient that half of the ligament be placed on the knot and the other below the fracture towards the shoulder blade.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly if the fracture is near the shoulder blade, then it is convenient that the ligament be placed on that place and on that shoulder blade.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Fill that which is facilitated and its trouble, and then when it will be filled according to what is convenient and it is applied for good application, then bind that if there is no hot abscess.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	But if there is a hot abscess, then loosen the stricture until the seventh day, and place on it a warm poultice wrapped in seven layers of oil and rose water until the abscess subsides, and then you bind that.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	And the manner of binding that is to place a plaster cast on the fracture, and then place an envelopment of new cloth around the plaster cast; and then adjust the arm on that helper, and place its hand bent over the shoulder muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And place the cloth and bind around the helper the arm so that the arm is in its proper place of stability, if it does not prohibit any cause of the broken bone.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use stability.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that which places on the fracture that stability which is more firm and stronger than the other stabilities; and place between each stability the width of the finger, and let the length of the stabilites be according to the fracture with an addition of three fingers from the entire part.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then bind around the stabilites with the stricture which was mentioned at the beginning of the chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And it is that your stricture on the place of the fracture should be tighter.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And when the fracture is more elongated, the stricture should be less.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And then if you observe the situation of the stabilites and the stricture thus as we have said in the hour when you restore the member to its natural position, then you do.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you suspect an abscessed hip, then you will dissect the structure and the stars within the seventh day, as we have said before.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And then consider the ligament in all parts for three days so that it does not become inflamed or infected in the affected area; or it is forbidden to bring food to the member for fear of superfluous structuring; and thus rectify everything according to what we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	Perhaps you are confident that no cause of this will occur, then do not release the ligature until three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And let the patient's sleep be on their right side, and their other side should be towards the stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And pause on the cotton wool padding full of lanolin application, and consider at any hour of the night or day that the figure of the injured limb is not deformed or dissolved, or that the ligament is softened, thus rectify everything according to your true virtue.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And pause the food of the patient according to the order which we have given you, so that the food is subtle at the beginning until it begins to strengthen; and then cover that you thicken the food of theirs.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	It is customary for the adjunct and their leg to be strengthened in 40 days; and then it is fitting that they are released and administered a bath, and thus medicated with unguents which rectify that.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is badly damaged, then you do not release the ligament and the stars within a day or within two months.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	On the restoration of fractures of the arm.
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones which are called two forearm-bones; of which one is small and it is the one that is called the radius, and the other is large and it is the one that is placed below the small radius, from the part below.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And it happens that the larger forearm-bone alone is broken, or the smaller one, and it happens that they are broken together.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the smaller forearm-bone is broken below, then its restoration is easier, and its healing is even easier.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the forearm-bone of it is broken above the fracture of it is bad, and its healing is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And worse than that is when both bones are broken together.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore, if the bone that is broken is the smaller forearm-bone below, then it is convenient for the doctor to pause a little extension in order to facilitate the healing of that.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	Perhaps if the larger forearm-bone is the one that is broken, then it is fitting to pause a more vigorous extension.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if both forearm-bones are broken together, then it is fitting that you pause the strongest extraction.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And it is fitting that you pause the figure of the hand from the restoration of it and the extension of it extended on a cushion, and let the pulse of the hand be at the parts above, more than all the other fingers, and the auricular finger be lower than the other fingers, and the patient be seated on a wooden chair.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And let there be a cushion placed underneath it in its height or elevation, so that the patient does not incur trouble.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	And then extend the minister's arm from the affected part downwards to the healthy hand or ligament, and another minister extends similarly from above.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	And then the doctor reduces the bone into place so that it returns to its best figure as much as possible.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if in the fracture of the bone there are splinters, then you must forcibly reduce all the fragments into their place with your true virtue.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if it appears in the separated splinter that holds the cord and does not hope for its restoration, then you finish over it and leave it according to the manner which we have said above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	Perhaps if the fracture is a plague, you have already done it at this singular chapter, and thus take the care of that.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if you suspect an abscessed hip at the beginning of your restoration, then you line up a drap with cerate made of rosated oil and white wax, and it is better between specificity and subtlety, and strengthen the drap over that in a subtle structure until the abscess is calmed; and then remove the cerate and pause to apply a plaster prepared from powder of mulberry on a clear day, and then pause for stars; and let the star be the one that is paused over that fracture more gently and more strongly.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And you know that the number of stars on the arm is seen in the major dispositions, or it is a fracture in one forearm-bone or in both forearm-bones together.

And then pause your structure over the place of the fracture more strongly and more vigorously, and when perhaps it will be the extraction at the parts above the fracture or at the parts below it, pause the structure a little while more softly according to what precedes the remembrance of it at the beginning of the chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the draps that are enveloped over the fracture are very humid draps, and they are not hard nor harsh, and the faith in which it is strengthened is of its own proper middle way between subtle and gross, as we have recommended.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	Examine the limb and its ligaments for several days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if you find any cause for which correction is necessary, then proceed with the correction of the limb, and meanwhile prepare a warm compress to apply to the affected area until the correction takes effect.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And leave the limb unconstricted until it rests, and then return the structure to its normal state.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the extraction has been softened and the bone has been re-aligned and appears similar to the others, then rectify all that is yours in its virtue.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	And consider that the nutrient is prohibited from reaching the limb due to an excess of structure, because meanwhile you soften it a little and leave it for several days until it can receive the nutrient, and then strengthen it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	Perhaps if the patient does not find any cause for those things that we have said, then it is not suitable to delay until about 20 days or around that time.
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	And then the hand of the patient should be suspended in its virtuous movement, and make it sleep on its back.
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	And you will know that this fracture is restored in 30 days or in 32 days, or perhaps it is restored in 28 days, and all that is according to the disposition of the complications and the dispositions of the virtue.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	On the restoration of fractures of the finger and of the toes.
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	You will know that the fingers of the hand and the toes are prone to fracture, and they do not receive correction without very gentle and carefully considered movements.
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	And when there is a fracture or dislocation in the hand, then it is necessary for the patient to follow a straight and equal direction, and then place their hand on that extension.
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	And then the minister extends the broken bones and sets them in place, so that they are reunited with good conjunction.
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	And then it is necessary to apply an emplaster and a bandage, if you do not find an abscess or tumor; and then place a star-shaped dressing underneath according to the quantity of the location, and you have already enveloped that in a linen cloth.
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	Perhaps if the bandage is in the divided parts of the belly of the palm, and then make it resemble a spear of cloth, and command the patient to strengthen that with their wounded palm; then it will be strengthened with a long cloth.
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	And the star-shaped dressing of cloth in which it is elevated, so that the body can be applied to the palm; and strengthen that according to what is necessary.
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	Perhaps if the fracture is in the forepart, then it is necessary to place a star-shaped dressing underneath and another on the part below in the palm, so that the hand can be uplifted and straightened; and then place the structure, thus revolving the hand to its natural position among the fingers.
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	And if you find a fracture at the knuckle of the toes, then if it is the toe that is affected, it should be set according to what is necessary and then strengthened in the palm, and if you want, place a small, straightened bandage around it so that the fracture is elevated and not dislocated.
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	Perhaps if the fracture is in the other toes, thus as in that of the middle place, or in the index finger, or in the ear, or in the ring finger, then it should be set and tied to the toe itself; or all the ties are according to continuity, and it is better; or place on top of a small star-shaped dressing, thus as we have said for the toes.
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	And consider, in your restoration, and then that, the disposition of abscess or tumor and opposite — in the surgical operation — in what is necessary when you find any cause among those, according to which the narration of it is repeated.
Capitol .xiv.	Chapter 14.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	On the restoration of fractures of the bone in the hip.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bone of the hip is very fragile and is declared to the sentiment according to which it is converted to the part above and to the upper layer.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	And the restoration of it is done in such a way that the ligament is strengthened over the fracture and another ligament below the fracture, and the patient is prostrate on their back and on their face.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	And then the minister extends all the ligaments to their part according to the quality, when the fracture is in the middle place of the bone.
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	Perhaps if it is proposed to the root of the hip, then the ligament is proposed to the dentate at the part of the pelvis, so that the extension remains in its place, and the other ligament below the fracture.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	And similarly if the break is proposed to the dentate, then it should be made into a ligament proposed to the dentate, and the extension should be to the parts below.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	And then the doctor sets the bone in place with both its natural joints so that it is reduced according to its natural semblance and the bone is joined by good conjunction; then it is necessary to apply an emplaster and a bandage, if you do not find an abscess or tumor in the limb.

More frequently, it happens in the aposteme (abscess), then you leave it like that for several days until the abscess is drained, and then return to your care.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The treatment of it is done thus: cover the fracture with a hard bandage, and double or triple wrap it, and remove the superfluous part; and then cover the leg up to the ankle and the root of the thigh.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	And insert a long filament between the thigh and the leg near the knee, and guide the extremities of the filament to the affected parts below, and then wrap it around the leg and thigh so that it does not slip out of the bandage.
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	And then stop on the thigh at the place of that fracture thus, and stop one star-shaped bandage over the bone of the leg.
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	And then fill in the empty spaces between the leg and the thigh with many folds, so that the extricated structure is consolidated.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	And then begin a strong treatment on the middle of the affected part with three or four wraps, and as you feel yourself getting better in the alignment of the fracture, your treatment will be less and lighter and more gentle.
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	And then extend the two extremities of the filament to the affected parts below until they reach the heel of the foot, and strengthen both extremities of the star-shaped bandages on the other part so that the alignment is not removed from its place.
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	And then leave the treatment on that, so that it does not cause corrosion to the member nor abscess nor inflammation and similar things; and if any of these causes occur, then cut off the defective part, and correct what has been done wrongly, according to what we have said many times.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	More often, it happens in the bone where the pain is, then cover what you have wounded according to your ability; and if not, put a dressing on it and leave it, and cure what preceded the memory until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	And several times it is strengthened, this fracture of the thigh and other things that are adjusted to the star-shaped bandages, thus as we have said in the adjunct and in the arm.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	More often in the restoration of it, thus is done so that it does not cause limping to the patient; and if it is restored alone, or another thing that must be applied to the other leg, then it is necessary that it be limped from what was before.
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios. Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	On the restoration of the fracture of the kneecap of the knee.
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	You know that a fracture of the kneecap of the knee is difficult to heal, it more often causes many troubles.
Mays si accideys a lu fractura, lahoras no es sino fissura o trauc en las suas partidas, e aquo es am plagua o ses plagua, e sobre aquo tot es estat am le sentiment.	More often it happens to the fracture, then it is not just a crack or break in its parts, and that is a plague or several plagues, and about that all has been said with the sentiment.
E la restauracio de lu es enayssi que sia engualat aquo que es romput de las partidas de lu am les ditz entro que sia agreguat e conjongit segon que es possible per equacio e facilitat e fabricacio.	And the restoration of it is thus, that it is grafted with what has been broken from its parts, to be joined together as much as possible through equilibrium and facilitation and fabrication.

Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	On the restoration of the fracture of the leg.
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	You know that in the leg there are two bones, one of which is large, and it is named by the name of the leg; and the other is subtle, and it is named fibula.
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una.	And it happens to some species of fracture that it happens to the two bones of the arm, and for this reason the restoration of it is done thus as the restoration of the arm by grafting, and the operation of it is one.
E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	And if both bones are broken together, the leg is converted into all its parts.
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	And if the thin bone is broken, the leg is converted into the lower parts.
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	And if the large bone is broken, it affects those below, and it is one of those causes that are not easily amended.
E aprop aministra extencio e equacio e liguacio de las astelas segon aquel engualment.	And then administer extension and equilibrium and ligamentation of the stars according to that grafting.

More often, it happens that if the fracture of the leg is old and has many complications, the extension should be less and lighter, and it alleviates your virtue.
E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	And in the leg there is some cause of operation on the arm, and it is when you graft the star-shaped bandages and complete all the tie-up operation, then you take measures of wood or pine which are placed below the causes that were placed alone, and make a support of palm branches; remove those from the ones that are small and fragile, and not be heavy on the handles, and let them be the length of those according to the length of the leg, and of the knee up to the foot.
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	And then envelop each drap in two enveloping bandages according to the length of it, and place one on the top of the leg on one side and the other on the bottom of the foot.
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	And then bind the two stilhes in three places on the extremities and at the middle location, because with this structure the leg is prohibited from bending to the right and left sides, and it remains in good position.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	And then administer a wooden splint according to the length of the leg; and it is placed on the leg so that it conserves its movement.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	And especially be careful that you do not make a fracture, and when you have that plague properly.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And then consider each day the leg and study it for further study, and you will guard against aposteme and inflammation or other similar causes; and when any of those causes occur, then you will pause to examine what is happening inside so that it may be healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	On the fracture of the ankle and bones of the foot and toes.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	The ankle does not often suffer a complete fracture; rather the bones of the foot sometimes suffer fragmented fractures; and the toes of the foot rarely suffer fractures, and they do not occur unless there is an awkward disposition.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.	And if the bones of the foot suffer a fracture and sometimes those bones are elevated above each other, then the patient pauses to place their foot on the ground prepared in this way as an aid.
E aprop pausa la un pe sobre aquo que es elevat de aquels osses, e aprop calca aquels, e prem, e engualha aquels entro que torno en los locs.	And then pause to place one foot on what is elevated by those bones, and then calcify them, and press, and bandage them so that they return to their places.
E aprop pausa emplastre e stopa desus, e pausa dejos le ventre del pe una petita taula a la qual sian dos caps plas.	And then apply a plaster and stop above, and place underneath the belly of the foot a small table to which are attached two flat plates.
E aprop strenh aquela am le pe am strectura descent, pus que tu has envolopada aquela am draps e am autres causes de las quals indigeys.	And then strengthen that around the foot in a descending structure, because you have enveloped that with drapes and other causes among which it is indicated.
E cum a lu passan tres dias o quatre, lahoras tu deslia le liament, quar tu atrobaras les osses engualatz, o sian trincatz o sian dislocatz, e la operacio en aquels es ayssi co coneysses.	And when three or four days have passed, then you will release the binding, because you will find the bones reunited, or reset, or relocated, and the operation on them is thus successfully concluded.
Mays si alcus ditz son trincatz, lahoras restaura aquels, e enguala aquels ayssi cum yeu e recomtat a tu en la restauracio dels ditz de la ma.	But if some toes are reset, then restore them, and bandage them thus as I have instructed you in the restoration of the toes of the hand.

And then place the reset toe stilhes according to the length of the toe, and it is placed a little apart from one another; and then place underneath the foot this table that I have recommended to you, and strengthen that around the structure descending.
Mays si aquo que es trincat dels osses so dos o tres o mays, lahoras tu pausa sobre quascun dit astela de la sua quantitat envolopada en drap leon, e strenh la taula en le pus bas del pe, e sia stant sobre la un dels caps de la taula foro le ventre del pe per que la tengua am bona retencio.	But if what is reset of the bones is two or three or more, then you place over each toe stilhes according to its quantity enveloped in a lion's drap, and strengthen the table at the bottom of the foot, and stand on one of the plates of the table above the belly of the foot so that it holds with good retention.
E es convenient a tu que no oblides que no consideres totas las causas las quals que e ditas a tu en las autras fracturas dels accidentz que havem dit; e opausa te a tot accident am aquo que cove.	And it is convenient for you that you do not forget to consider all the causes which I have told you in the other fractures of accidents that we have mentioned; and pause to examine every accident so that you may know what is happening inside.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De fractura del conh de la femna e del os del pentenilh e de la vergua del home.	On the fracture of the knee of the woman and of the bone of the penis and of the wound of the man.
Quan le conh de la femna es trincat, lahoras fay aquela ceser en cezela cayrada, e aprop enclina aquela a la partida del dos un petit, e sia tenguda detras.	When the knee of the woman is broken, then make her sit on a chair, and bend it towards the back of the two little ones, and hold it behind.
E aprop la matrona umpla le conh de coto, e sia fayt en le conh de lu ayssi cum spera; e aprop la femna sia concutida, e eleva le dos de lu petit a petit, quar tot aquo es fora-getat entro que sia denant la partida del conh ayssi cum spera e l’os trincat retorna.	And then the matron supports the knee from behind, and does it to the knee of hers just as I have spoken; and then the woman is consoled, and raises the back of her little one little by little, because all that is forgotten returns until it is in front of the knee just as I have spoken and the broken bone returns.
E aprop pausa pulvils sobre le dos de lu, e quan vol urinar remaugua le coto am facilitat e aprop urine, e reduzeys e retorna aquel segon la manieyra segon la qual mezist aquel al comensament, e aprop retorne al sieu pulvil primier.	And then place poultices on the back of hers, and when she wants to urinate, remove the behind of her to facilitate it, and reduce and return that according to the manner according to which you began at the beginning, and then return to the first poultice.
E fassa ayssi per vii dias o enviro aquels, quar aquel es restaurat.	And do it thus for seven days or around those, because that is restored.
E si voles, pren una vezica de ovela e strenh sobre le trauc de lu una canula de canavera; e entromet tota la vesica en le conh de lu, e aprop ensuffla en la canula am vertut entro que la vesica sia imflada dedintz le conh, quar la fractura retorna.	And if you wish, take once a small tube of cane and strengthen it over the thigh of hers with a reed of cane; and insert the whole bladder into her knee, and then inflate through the tube until the bladder is inflated inside the knee, because the fracture returns.
E aprop sia umplida de coto e estia per alcus dias segon que havem recomtat, entro que sia sanat.	And then it is filled from behind and stays for several days according to what we have recommended, until it is healed.
E quan le os del pentenil de home o de femna es trincat, lahoras aministra en la restauracio e agulacio de lu aquo que havem recomtat en l’os del anca.	And when the bone of the penis of the man or woman is broken, then administer in the restoration and adjustment of it what we have recommended for the bone of the hip.
E aquo que es dreyt no es occultat en aquestas fracturas proprinquas e que pauc endeveno, majorment ad aquel al qual es alcun studi e us e enten aquest meu libre mot; quar aquela fractura significa a tu en las majors disposicios via dreyturiera en la restauracio e en la strictura de lu, e donc enten be.	And that which is straight is not hidden in these fractures, and little happens, mainly to those who are somewhat studious and use and understand my free book; because that fracture indicates to you in the major dispositions via direct methods in the restoration and structure of it, and therefore understand well.
Mays en la vergua del home quan es trincada, pren guarguamela de auca, e met la vergua en aquela; e aprop pausa sobre lu envolucio de drap, e sia envolopada, e aprop sia layssada per tres dias o enviro aquels, e sia sanada.	When the man is afflicted in the groin area because of being wounded, take a poultice of water, and place it on that area; then pause over the wrapped dressing, and let it be enveloped, and then leave it like that for three days or around that time, and he will be healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De restauracio de fractura dels osses quan es am plagua.	On the restoration of fractures of bones when they are badly bruised.
Convenient es ad aquel al qual accideys fractura am plagua, e majorment si le os es gran ayssi cum es le os de la cuoyssa o de l’adjutori, o semblant ad aquel, que tu te cuoytes e fleubotomes aquel tantost si las condicios de fleubotomia a tu o testifican ayssi cum desus havem dit.	It is convenient for the one to whom a fracture occurs badly bruised, and more so if the bone is large, like the bone of the hip or of the joints, or similar to that, that you take care and fleubotomize as much as possible, according to the conditions of fleubotomy that are suitable for you or testify as we have said above.
E si la plagua eflueys sanc, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la retencio de lu enayssi que tu polverizes sobre lu zegi trissat, si a tu autra causa no es present.	And if the bruise flows with blood, then it is necessary that you take care of its retention in such a way that you powders above the injured place, if no other cause is present.
E aprop comensa restaurar la fractura en aquel meteys dia, e no prolongues aquo, si no accideys apostema.	And then begin to restore the fracture on that same day, and do not prolong it, unless an abscess occurs.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la restauracio de lu entro al ix dia, entro que sia cedat le apostema, e no apropinques a lu en le tertz dia e·l iiii de tot, quar tu faras accidir mals accidentz.	But if an abscess occurs cautiously, then you delay the restoration of it until the sixth day, until the abscess is discharged, and do not approach it on the third day or the fourth, because you will cause bad accidents.
Mays si le os trencat es eminent sobre la codena descubert, lahoras cove que te perforses reduzir aquel e engualar aquel am las tuas mas am facilitat e am pauca extencio.	But if the broken bone is prominent above the uncovered cartilage, then it is necessary that you perforate to reduce it and enclose it with your fingers as much as possible and with little extension.
Mays si extencio no es a tu preparada e la equacio de lu am las tieuas mas, lahoras tu reduzeys aquel am las tuas mas am aquest sturment; e es sturment le qual es fayt de ferr, la longitut del qual es de vii ditz o de viii e la latitut del qual es segon la quantitat de la plagua; e per aquo es necessari al metge que prengua de aquels tres o quatre segon la quantitat que indigeys ad aquo en la curacio en tota specia de fractura.	But if the extension is not prepared by your fingers as much as possible, then you reduce it with your fingers as much as possible to this instrument; and this instrument is made of iron, the length of which is seven or eight digits and the width of which is according to the quantity of the bruise; and for that reason it is necessary for the doctor to take account of these three or four according to the quantity that is indicated by him in the treatment of every kind of fracture.
E sia redon, e sia en lu pauca groceza per so que no sia doblat deves la comprecio sobre aquel en la hora de la operacio.	And it should be rounded, and it should be in a small groove so that it is not doubled over itself during the operation hour.
E sia de aguda extremitat al qual sia marge en las sieuas extremitatz; e sia le desus de lu a grossetut tendent, e de la maytat de lu entro a las partidas.	And it should be of acute extremity to which the margin is in the six extremities; and it should be below it with a thick tendon, tending from the middle towards the divided parts.
E aquesta es la forma de lu:	And this is its shape:
E es nompnat en grec “labre volentz atelarem”, so es paleta pauca.	And it is named in Greek "labre volentz atelarem", thus it is a small spatula.
Per que cove que sia pausada la extremitat de lu acuda elevada sobre la extremitat del os eminent.	Because it is necessary that the extremity of the acute elevated part be paused above the extremity of the prominent bone.
E inpelleys aquel en una veguada entro que retorne le os, e sia engualat am alcuna equacio.	And press it in a gentle way until the bone returns, and it is enclosed with some equilibrium.
E donc esforsa te engualar las extremitatz de la fractura entre lor, e si la extremitat de lu trencada es subtil, e no pren aquela le sturment per bona axcepcio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas la extremitat de aquel os entro que l’insturment haja poder de aquo.	And then it is necessary to enclose the extremities of the fracture among them, and if the extremity of the broken bone is subtle, and you do not take that instrument for good acceptance, then it is necessary that you insert the extremity of that bone until the instrument has power over it.
Mays si no podes reduzir le os de tot am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras enscideys aquel am aquo que coveneys a lu dels inscizoris les quals havem ditz; o serra aquel am una de las serras en qualque manieyra sia a tu possible.	But if you cannot reduce the bone in every way that we have recommended, then insert it in a way that is suitable for the instruments which we have mentioned; or saw it with one of the saws in whatever manner it may be possible for you.
E aprop ratz aquel que roman en le os de asperitat e de scorsas menudas.	And then scrape off what remains on the bone of roughness and of small, tender scars.
E cum le os es reduzit, e aprop la reduccio le malaute atroba dolor vehement ledent, lahoras sapias que le os no es retornat al sieu loc natural; e adonc fay aquo quar tu confereyses al malaute gran juvament.	And when the bone is reduced, and then the reduction brings great pain to the patient, vehemently, then you know that the bone has not returned to its natural place; and therefore do that which you confer with the patient for great comfort.
Cum es complida la tua restauracio la qual fas al os, e lahoras submergeys drap en vi stiptic negre, e propriament si es en estiu, e no pauses sobre la plagua cerot ni autre causa en la qual sia oli, per so que no fassa en lu accidir poyredura e corropcio.	When you have completed the restoration which you do to the bone, and then submerge it in a sixth steeping of black vinegar, and properly if it is in summer, and do not pause over the bruise or any other cause in which there is oil, so that it does not become putrid and corrupt.
E aprop aministra stelas en la hora del tieu compliment de la restauracio de l’os, e layssa la plagua descuberta enayssi que inscidas le trauc am forfexs e uses de envolucios segon la quantitat de la plagua.	And then administer stelas at the hour of the completion of the restoration of the bone, and leave the uncovered bruise in such a way that you insert the bandage with forceps and uses of envelopings according to the quantity of the bruise.
E guarda te am tota cautela que no strenhas la plagua am la fractura, quar motas veguadas an fayt aquo les fols metges, e fero accidir sobre les sieus malautes mort o malautia corrodent o zuthement, so es sania.	And beware that you do not strengthen the bruise on the fracture, because many vain efforts are made by foolish doctors, and they cause death or corrupting mortality, or sudden death, so it is sanity.
E si la tieua strictura leugiera, molli, diversa de la strictura de las autras fracturas.	And if the structure of the tissue is loose, soft, different from the structure of other fractures.
E si la plagua es gran o es plagua mala, e temes sobre aquel alcus accidentz mals les quals havem recomtatz, e atrobas dolor en le loc, lahoras no cove que pauses sobre aquel astelas, mays fay ad aquel envolucio de draps durs en loc de stelas e strenh lu am aquelas.	And if the bruise is great or is a bad bruise, and you fear those bad accidents which we have recommended, and it brings pain to the place, then it is not necessary that you pause over those stelas, but rather do that enveloping of harsh dressings in place of stelas and strengthen it with those.
E cum aprop un dia o dos vezes ja la plagua comensar, que en lu sia engendrat brac, lahoras tu osta desus le drap le qual havias pausat sobre aquel am vi, e aprop aministra calguas, enguentz am les quals de nostra constuma es que mediquem las plaguas, ayssi cum enguentz tetrafarmacon e semblantz ad aquel.	And when one or two days have passed since the bruise began, which has generated a swelling, then you remove from below the dressing which you had placed over it for six days, and then administer cooling remedies, entreating them as we are accustomed to medicate bruises, thus entreating tetrafarmacon and similar to that.
E conveneys a tu que deslias le liament e considera la plagua en quascun dia mati e vespre entro que sia consolidada e fermada, e cove que·l membre sia preparat en tal manieyra que la poyredura corra de lu a las partidas dejos am facilitat.	It is convenient for you to dissolve the ligament and consider the plague in every morning and evening until it becomes consolidated and firm, and see that the member is prepared in such a way that the pus can flow from it to the affected parts easily.
si a la plagua passan motz dias, e no es consolidada ni es abscindit de lu le brac, lahoras sapias que aqui so satagias de las petitas per que cove enquieras la plagua am tenta.	If the plague does not pass in many days, and it is not consolidated nor has it receded from the arm, then you know that here are stagnations of the humors because the plague attempts to inquire into the plague with tension.
E de aquelas satagias aquelas que so separadas remau e extratz, aquelas que de lor no so separadas e pongen le membre e fan accidir dolor, perforsa te a inscidir aquelas segon que a tu aquo es possibla.	And from those stagnations, those that are separated remain and are extracted, those that are not separated and put the member in a state of pain, therefore try to incise those according to what is possible for you.
E si accideys a la plagua zuchem o eluchen, so es stiomenios, o autra specia de corrupcio e de putrefaccio, lahoras cove que pauses a quada un de aquels am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio del qual es precedida narracio en le sieu capitol.	And if you find the plague is acidic or ulcerous, it is stubborn, or another species of corruption and putrefaction, then you know that one of those has been paused which is convenient for him from the cure of which a preceding narration is made in the seventh chapter.
E de aquo en le qual cove que stia lo mieu sermo e tu fassas present la tua pessa: quan os gros es trincat, emineys sobre le membre ayssi cum le os de la coyssa e del ajutori e semblantz ad aquels dels membres grans, e que no presumas atraccio de lu, ni la extraccio de lu quar motas veguadas accideys per aquo la mort; habantz layssa aquel entro que poyresca, quar fort leu cayra per si aprop xx dias o .xxx.; e lahoras cura la plagua si a tu es vist, e si no layssa aquela.	And of that which you know stays in the worst sermon and you make present your effort: when the bone is crushed, emollients are placed over the member just like the bones of the thigh and of the helper, and it seems similar to those of the large members, and do not assume attraction from it, nor the extraction of it because four motive veins have been opened for that which causes death; holding back there that enters, because the strong vein perishes if you delay for 20 days or more. And then cure the plague if you have seen it, and if there is not that one.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De la curacio de nodacio que accideys en le vestigi de alcuna fractura.	On the cure of nodes that occur in the signs of some fracture.
Motas veguadas accideys aquesta nodacio en le vestigi de sanacio de fractura, e majorment que es prop de las juncturas, e es orrasada per lu la figura del membre; e fort leu prohibeys le membre de la sua operacio natural.	Many opened nodes occur in the signs of healing of fracture, and mostly because they are close to the joints, and it is ordered by the figure of the member; and strongly prohibits the member from its natural operation.
Adonc considera si la nodacio es recent e aministra en aquela medicinas que han stipticat ayssi co es aloen, e enses, e mira, e sercacollo, e acrassia, e semblantz ad aquels; enayssi que prenguas de aquela alcunas o totas, e comfesiys aquelas am vi stiptic, o am album de huou, o am vi agre, e pausa aquela sobre la nodacio en estopa, e constringeys aquelas sobre lu per bona constriccio.	Then consider if the node is recent and administer in those medicines that have been stipulated, such as aloen, enses, mira, sercacollo, acrassia, and similar to those; also take some or all of those, and combine them, either stipated, or album of Huou, or agreed, and place it on the node in a stop, and constrict them over it for good consolidation.
E leyssa extrictura que no deslies aquela per motz dias; e aprop deslia aquela e itera autra, entro que sia remauguda la nodacio; o strenh sobre aquela lamina de plom descentment, quar plom ha proprietat de remaure tot aquo que es imflat en les membres.	And let the extrication not dissolve for many days; and then extract it and iterate another, until the node is removed; or strengthen over that layer of lead decently, because lead has the property of removing all that which is inflamed in the members.
Mays si nodacio ja es en peyra convertida e streyta es e nessessitat provoca a ostar aquela coytadament, e lahoras scindeys aquela per la partida pus sobirana de lu, e inscideys la superfluitat e eminent, o ratz aquela am alcus rezoris entro que sia remauguda; e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Maybe the node is already converted into stone and strengthened, and it is necessary to provoke an ostensible contradiction, and then scatter it for the superior part above it, and incise the superfluity and eminence, or root out that with some remedies until it is removed; and cure that until it is sanctified.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De restauracio de fractura quan es restaurada e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul no segon la sieua natura.	On the restoration of fracture when it is restored and then returns the subtle member to its natural freedom according to its own nature.
Quan fractura de os es restaurada, e aprop aquo roman le membre subtil e freul, lahoras aquo no es fayt sino per motas causas: de las quals la una es multitut de solucio del liament e de la liguacio de lu fayta no segon que cove; o per superfluitat de strictura dels liamentz entro que·l nutriment sia prohibit correr al membre; o per multitut de embrocaccio superflua; o per movement superfluent no en la sua hora; o per pauquesa de sanc en le cors del malaute e per debelitat de lu.	When a fracture of the bone is restored, and then returns the subtle member to its natural freedom, then it is not done except for many causes: of which one is multitude of solution of the ligament and of the bonding not according to what is known; or for superfluity of structure of the ligaments until the nourishment is prohibited from flowing to the member; or for multitude of superfluous embrocation; or for superfluous movement not in its hour; or for lack of health in the body of the patient and for debilitation of it.
E curacio de aquo es dar a mengar al malaute e far le cor de lu tendre entro que·l sanc sia multiplicat en lu; e aministra banh; e entromet gaug e leticia sobre lu. And then pause the poultice over the member, so that the poultice attracts to it much nourishment, or continues to embrocate with water and tepid warmth, until the nourishment flows and returns to its natural figure.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	On the cure of crushed bones when they are restored tortuously and prohibit the operation of their own that is known.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When it occurs to the member already restored with the healing of its own tortuousness and eminence to the crushed bone and node, and it is for that fed in the form of the member, maybe empowers the member not to be prohibited from its natural operation, then you do not know that you receive the word of one who existed, that member was newly crushed.

Maybe the paralysis and node are recent, then you know that they are embrocated with tepid warmth in which they take mollifying herbs, just like they are fuels of altea and radish of it, and mellilot, and similar to those; and it is done with an emplaster of mollifying emplastering just like Dyallaquilon has done well; or that it takes mucilage of radish of altea and is continued in gray of gualina or oil of cirami, and is emplastered there; or that they take figs grasses and are treated with fems of colom, and similar to those of the medicines that are named Americans consolidation.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	Some remedies are dissolved in a steady friction oil that is among the most humid, and it should be administered with gentle movements of the entire limb at all hours.
