Perhaps it is twisted and has gone downwards and is made strong and converted into stone and provoked the need for iron therapy, then it is necessary to cover that which has settled above the affected area and the continuity of the bones is dissolved, and it is incised so that what flows from the nodes of those limbs is superfluous, and it is facilitated in that solvent which is stimulated and studied.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De sermo en dislocacio.	On ulcers and dislocations.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is a displacement of some of the joints in their proper place, so that it is prohibited from movement, and the shape of the limb is altered, and it brings upon the patient great pains and large lesions.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore when accidents happen due to a dislocation, then it is necessary to perform reduction as soon as possible, and not delay that reduction, because if it is delayed, the place becomes apostemated and very strong, which makes the reduction of the dislocation difficult.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And for this reason it is not necessary to massage or stretch at the time of apostema, because many vigorous movements bring about spasms and pains.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	Perhaps when it happens, then it is necessary to apply yourself to the flaccidity of the patient, and then it is laid still so that the apostema relapses; and then the limb is wrapped in hot water and oil, and then it is reduced with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And the entire limb is treated with the water of which the memory will come back to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And now I have ordered the chapters on dislocation according to what has been preceded in fracture; from the upper part of the body down to the lower part.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	On the treatment of dislocation of the lower jawbone.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So the two jawbones are dislocated if they do not close; and the dislocation of both is done in one of two ways: either they are removed from their places with little movement, and are softened a little; or they are completely dislocated and complicated, until they are softened at the joint so that corrosive saliva from the patient flows out and cannot hold it nor clear its mouth, and the patient's tongue is enveloped in its speech.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	Perhaps when the dislocation of it is slight, then in major arrangements it returns by itself for a slight cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	Perhaps if the dislocation is complete and complicated, then it is necessary to administer reduction of it promptly, and not delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And it is that the minister holds the head of the patient, and meanwhile places their finger on the root of the dislocation of the lower jawbone inside the patient's mouth, if the dislocation is on one side; or they place both fingers simultaneously, if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other fingers are placed above them which are engaged; and commands the patient to stop moving their jaws and releases those from any part; and the minister carefully places the jawbone and wraps it so that it returns to its proper place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction of it is difficult, and especially if both jawbones are simultaneously dislocated, then administer evaporation with hot water and oil, so that the reduction of both is made easier and does not delay the reduction of both at all, thus as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And thus when they are returned and so wrapped, and the patient's mouth is closed and not softened, then pause on those pillows of drapery with cerote, and it is made of wax and oil rosated; and then it is tied with ease in a gentle manner.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And the patient should sleep on their back, and their head should be positioned between two aurelhes, so that they do not incline to the right or left side; and do not force them to chew anything for a long time; having the healthy diet forbidden, until when the pains are removed and the jawbones are numb, then it is allowed to eat what they want.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And this should be administered with ease, and do not trouble about the perception of the mouth, unless eating and drinking and citation, until the jawbone is numb and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of both jawbones is difficult when they are dislocated at any hour and not converted to their proper places, then many vigorous movements happen with fevers and steady soda, and strongly it affects the patient's stomach, and strongly it vomits pure cholera.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then you will know that it is pernicious; and many vigorous deaths occur to the one who suffers from this in ten days.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of dislocation of the ankle and of the extremity of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The ankle is not dislocated from the foot because of its continuity with the foot; and some vigorous movements are dislocated at the front part, and this is declared by sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of it is that the patient lies on his back and extends his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then place your hand on the area in your palm with strong pressure, because it will return there.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	Then put a pause on that plaster and powders and strengthen it.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	May the extremity of one who has seized the hip and is continued in it, not be dislocated on any day; then it is necessary that it be reduced and bandaged according to what we have said and according to your appliance.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And then put a pause on that plaster, and powders, and extract, and command the patient to adhere to tranquility and rest until they are healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And in this medical treatment, the extremity of the muscle is reduced when it is separated from its proper place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of muscle dislocation.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, of which one is that it is dislocated from the top to the bottom.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated above the muscle, and that is done sharply; and it is not dislocated behind by the shoulder; and it is not dislocated below by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And mostly it is dislocated and therefore exits at the bottom parts of the thigh, and mostly in those where the flesh is thin, it is easily dislocated; but in those where the flesh is thick, it is exited with difficulty.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And often accidents happen to some men through percussion or fall, and the muscle of it is affected by a hot abscess, and it is bruised because it has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Then it is necessary that you spread it out so that you are above-mentioned about it, and then you proceed with its cure.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is recognized the dislocation of it when it is at the bottom parts of the thigh; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the sound one, because you find among them manifest diversity; and you find in the head of the concave muscle and below the thigh, from the touch of the head of the muscle as if it were a hollow, and the patient cannot reduce his hand to its proper place, nor can he move at all.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated from the foot or above, and then you find a manifest touch, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And of this dislocation, a gentle reduction is made when it is fresh and the patient is in a favorable condition.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister raises his hand to the upper parts; and then he pauses with the toes placed below the thigh, and raises the joint strongly in its proper place, and the minister raises his hand, and extends it there; and then he pauses because it returns gently.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if it does not return for what we have said, and so from the beginning that the dislocation occurs, many days, then it is necessary that the patient be bathed in warm water and be administered an embrocation that softens and soothes, as if it were a poultice of altea, and fenugrec, and melillot in water, and be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	And then the patient should be placed on his back and paused below the thigh, expecting that it will be bandaged between relaxation and constriction, and then the doctor pauses with the hand on the spine, and raises the head of the muscle to its proper place, and releases the hand of the patient so that it is not hidden at the bottom parts, and another minister holds the head of the patient, so that it is not hidden at the bottom parts, because it returns quickly to its proper place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you want, reduce it in this manner: and it is that you make a present to a man who has been longer than the patient, and he is on the side of that bed, and he places his hand below the thigh of the patient and raises the thigh of it to the upper parts until the patient is suspended in air, and another minister pulls the hand of the patient from the bottom parts of the back.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is weak, then it is necessary that another cause be suspended, so that they help him, because the dislocation returns quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced in this way: and it is that it is fixed on the ground a long stick with a rounded figure, like a mortar pestle, which is not large nor subtle, and then it is paused below the patient; because it is paused over the head of the stick, the patient stands according to the length of the stick, and then his hand is extended to the bottom parts of the other side; and his body is extended from the other side with strength, because the joint returns to its proper place quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce it for all the causes that we have mentioned, then use this cure: and it is that you take a stick of the quantity of which is in the length of two arms, and its width is of four fingers, and its thickness is alleviated on the surface of the thigh according to this form.
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And place above the red cap a sheet of lions' skin, so that it does not touch the patient's body.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And place the patient's little finger, and extend your hand or arm within between the divided parts, and tie the patient's body to the helpers and arms and extremities of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	Place your arm on a step of a ladder according to the latitude, and the hand is extended to the divided parts below, and the other thing is suspended from the other side, so that the joint intra is stabilized.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the instrument is complete according to whatever manner is possible for you, and then cover that you apply below the little finger a quantity of wool soaked in a mixture of powdered moly and album of water over all the muscle, so that it is revolved from above, and place a strengthening bandage below the little finger with decent structure; and the ligament is revolved over the bandage, and the hand is attached to its neck, and be quiet, and do not move the hand for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And cover that the food of the patient is paused for a little while, until the member is comforted, because it is easier to attend to his health.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food is given in greater quantity around seven or eight, and an exercise of movement is made; and therefore if it is strengthened and not softened, then it is already healthy.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated many times due to humidity that affects it or for another cause, then it is necessary that a cautery be administered there in three tracts, as it has been said in the chapter on cauteries.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this is done and seven days are spent loosening the ligament and the joint is not strengthened, and the bandage and structure are reduced on many occasions, and it is not strengthened and cannot be elevated to the above parts, then you will know that the nerves of it, which are at the head of the muscle, are already injured or extended or softened, and you will know that the joint at no time will be fixed in its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	Regarding the dislocation of that which is done from the feet and thigh or the back parts, the reduction is made with impulse and extension in the hands, until it returns to its place.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And another structure is administered there, and care is taken until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if it affects the health of the member and slowness in its movement, then the patient uses many baths until that gravity is alleviated and returns to its natural state.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the cure of dislocation of the hip.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You know that the joint of the hip is dislocated with difficulty and similarly returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated in all parts, especially from the front to the back, and its dislocation is not hidden from you because it falls below the vein or below the ligament according to some figure being dislocated, and when you adjust the dislocated hip in the sauce, this is declared manifestly to you, because the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch that high muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And you know that the hips, and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible before it reaches a chronic apostemation, because if it reaches a chronic apostemation, difficult is its reduction, and hardly is it healed at all; especially when it is in the back parts, because worse is it than all other species of dislocations, and of greater pain, and many times it leads to death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce it, is that its hand is extended with two fingers, and its arm is expanded, and the fingers of the thigh are above the hip and below it, and the bandage wraps the joint with the toes of its own fingers, or at the base of its palm until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is in the front parts, then it returns also by bending the hand with its own hand, until it strikes the hip at the base of its palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey the reduction, then administer vehement extension and very strong force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is necessary that two ministers extend the arm, and hold that extremity with two ministers so that it is not removed from the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then the arm is revolved from all parts, because it is enveloped in a doubled cloth bandage over its hand, or ligament.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the thigh touches the joint with its hand, until that oil is applied for so that those causes which help in lubricating the joint are facilitated; and then the joint is strongly bandaged until it returns to its place.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then the reduction of it is seen to be placed on that bandage in which it is stipulated and exception is made with album of water, and is strengthened with decent structure, and the arm is suspended from its neck, and is left for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then release it; and so if the joint is formed in that place, then you release the ligament of it and let it be like that.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	If you see the joint is not strengthening, then you iterate the plaster and ligament, and let it be like that for several days until it is externalized; and then release it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	Maybe you should add gravity to the reduction of the joint, and its disposition is in movement, then administer humidity in baths and subtle friction, and compress, until it is alleviated; or pause on the joint alleviated, so it is a motor of great strength; and then release it, and let it be like that over the bone day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then remove that, and put it in baths; and when it sweats, then you rub the joint with tempered friction, and then iterate over that alleviated, so it is rotational of motor, one time, and the second, and the third.
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	in immersion of baths, until it is relaxed.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, pause on that humid and scaling wound with border and strengthen over that; and do some several times, because it is humid and reduces to its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	On the cure of dislocation of a bruised limb, so it is of the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	A bruised hand sometimes gets dislocated, and the reduction of its dislocation is easier, and conversely it is with other joints, but maybe especially because velocity is needed in the reduction of it at the hour when it is dislocated, provided that the place is apostematized or that it falls into an apostematic posture.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of its dislocation is that you place the joint of the hand of the patient on a table and the doctor extends the hand of that, and places his hand or his palm over the proximity of the joint, and presses until it returns to its own place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	Maybe especially because it is considered if the palm has been opposed to the belly of the hand, then the patient places the back of their hand on a table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is precedent over the back of the hand, then let the position of the hand of that be inherently on the table, so that the doctor's hand fits over that proximity of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And then it returns soon, good is; and if not, then strengthen that with an embrocation cedant the apostema and let it be like that; and do not iterate that, because if not, no suffering nor no pressure on the reduction of it, since it will pass in a few days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	Maybe the Roman joint is according to its tortuousness; and do not note to the patient any cause, but rather that the hand is mollified and cannot strengthen any cause; then you know that the nerves are pinched or compressed, and then it is not engendered in it except that it is strengthened with a pointed cautery for the sake of its improvement and fortifies that which confers some cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the bruise is returned, then pause on the embrocation which we have recommended, and let it be like that for five days; and then release it and let it be like that, and the hand of it should be exercised.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	Maybe if the movement of it is stopped and falls into some gravity, then you lift that with warm water and some friction several times, until it is alleviated.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	On the cure of dislocation of the toes.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some times they dislocate the toes completely apart.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when a toe is dislocated from among those to the back of the palm or to the belly of it, then stretch the toe and press the dislocation of it with the tied poultices, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then sustain the head of the toe, and suspend that from the part where it is dislocated, and let it be like that for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend that and extend that until it is straightened in its own day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when it is night, lay it according to that narration, and do not cease to release it in the day and exercise with movement, and lay it at night; and do that for several days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do similarly to that, if it is dislocated to the belly of the hand, and lay it at that part and do that in the first operation, until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do that when it is dislocated to other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	On the cure of dislocation of the vertebrae of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When it falls to one of the vertebrae of the back or neck, a complete dislocation, and so many vertebrae are removed from their places, then in that case there is no cure, because death comes quickly to the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And it is said that the evacuation of the patient is out of his will, and cannot retain that; and many times they mollify some members of it or two joints of it or two arms of it, or one of those; or a vertebra is removed from its place, because many times it is removed and many times it is done, making the removal of that into four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Therefore, it has already been shown in the previous parts and named gelbozitation.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	Maybe the cure of it is that sometimes they consider if the gelbozitation comes from poverty, because sometimes in that there is no cure nor salvation for all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	Maybe in that which is seen through percussion or similar to those, the Ancients already described the manners of cure in a prolix sermon, from which the most returns to profit; maybe you have already experienced relief from that for which little excuse is needed, due to the proximity to the intended meaning, in which they have exposed and formed diverse instruments, with which I will show and explain it.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in gelbozitation which comes from the inner part of the foot, there is no ingenuity nor salvation for that; and similarly in that which is made at two joints.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And of those it is not cured except the one that comes from the back properly, in that which you have recommended.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient should be extended on their face towards a wall near a partition, and should be extended under the instrument much in order to not hurt their feet.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And then a straight stake should be placed, fixed in the ground at the end of the wall around the patient's head, and another stake in the air holding their feet on the other side of the wall.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister holds the stake, and it should not be fixed in a ditch; and another minister holds the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then wrap around the patient's head and tie the bandages firmly; extend the extremity of the bandage to the stake which holds the patient's head, and tie it there; and then strengthen the other bandage on their hips, and tie their legs; and then adjust all the bandages and tie them to the other stake which holds their feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then the minister should carefully extend the bandage to the part of the stake, and do not disturb the two stakes and the bandages from their proper places where they are fixed, maybe afterwards it will not be firm as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor puts his palms on the spine with strength until it returns, or he puts them on that one table, and then adjusts the patient's feet on the table until they return.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	Maybe if it does not return by this method, then take a table of which the width or length is in the air of three arms, and carve on the wall where we have said that it is near the patient a place where the extremity of the table enters.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the flat surface of the table on the spine, and the doctor places their feet on the other extremity, and stretches it until the spine is straightened and returns to its proper place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, take it to the place which is revolving in the hand; and it is that you fix on the ground near the patient's head at the back of the wall two stakes, the length of which is one arm, and near the patient's head at the back of the wall also two stakes; and let the length be between each stake a palm, and already it is made in each stake a hole in which the rope will turn, and each should be firmly fixed on the ground so that it does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let there be a round stake in which the rope turns, and it revolves in the two holes of the two stakes.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the extremity of it there is a hole in which the stake is formed, the length of which is one palm where it revolves; and on the two other stakes it is similar to that.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then strengthen the bandages that are stretched on the patient's feet at the hole which holds their head, and the bandages that are stretched on their thighs at the rope which holds their feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then there should be a rope and a minister who turns the rope with his hand, and the doctor straightens the spine according to what we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the shape of the rope:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then since the spine is returned, and the place is straightened, then cover that you apply an excruciating plaster of albumen on the patient's back, and then stop; and then put it on the plaster like a table of which the width is three fingers or around that, and its length is as much as takes the place of the gout, and on the part of the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then let it be bound with the bandage that we have said, and use subtle nourishment to heal the patient until they are healthy.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there remains any weakness in the place at the end of the healing, then take care that medicines are administered which mollify and soothe, and administer them on the table for a long time, which we have recommended; and already it is administered in that place a thin layer of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And some weakened joints come to prominence at the back of the spine of the two, and it is suitable for that dislocation; and it is that bone which already warns you so that you do not try to make a premature recovery with this medicine, because it will strongly harm your attempt to act mortally.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 21.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated ankle.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You should know that the joint of the ankle and the joint of the muscle do not only dislocate, but also slip out of place, and do not receive those things that they receive from the other small joints with movement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the ankle joint is dislocated in four ways, either it is dislocated backwards, or forwards, or downwards, or upwards.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And mostly it is dislocated backwards, and rarely forwards or downwards.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of dislocation of it backwards is that, when you adjust the leg of the healthy person with the affected leg, it is longer and more prominent than the healthy one, and the affected leg cannot bend its knee joint, and it is the place where the knee joint is swollen with a warm apostema, so that the head of the thigh bone has arrived here.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that which receives a forward dislocation is that the accidents of it are contrary to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that which receives a downward dislocation is that the leg expands according to its natural tendency, but it cannot bend because of the pain in the knee, and if you force it to move and it cannot go upwards; and its urine is retained and its knee joint is swollen, and its walking is difficult on the ankle.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that which receives an upward dislocation is that it does not expand the knee, nor can it bend forward, and its leg is shorter than the other, and the knee joint is softened, and the head of the thigh bone is in a different place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	Moreover, the reduction of the species of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and chronic, that it has already become accustomed to having that part, you will administer reduction of it according to its disposition, then it is not in complete cure; and therefore it does not seem suitable for a prompt recovery.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	Moreover, in that case where the dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four species of dislocation, then you will find that you need to return the joint and extend it backwards and forwards, and move it to the right and left, so that it returns to its strength and does not require another cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	Moreover, if it does not return in this way, then it is necessary that you prepare a stronger minister and extend the leg from the affected part downwards, or with its own masses, or with the ligament which is tied above the knee; and another minister extends the hand of that one upwards so that it meets its own masses below the nipple; and you strengthen the ligament on the head of the thigh bone, and hold another minister to straighten the extremity of the ligament.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And its extension is from the ankle to the knee joint at the part of the hip, or from the back to the part of the spine.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And its extension is all of those in a single direction until the affected limb is elevated above the level of the ground and remains suspended.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this species of extension is common to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns to what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then it is necessary for all species that we speak of regarding proper cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of its own, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is backwards, it is necessary that the affected limb be resupinated above the level of the lateral thigh; and then pause the ligaments on the head of the thigh bone in that place between the head of the thigh bone and the knee joint below; and then extend the ligament from the part of the knee joint to the most distant part of the hip.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another strong minister takes hold of its arms, and embraces the large area of the affected thigh bone and extends to the forward parts by vigorous extension, so that it returns to its original place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this species is of the easiest cure, in which this member is reduced more easily than the other species.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	Moreover, if it is exempt from you and does not obey the entrance into this species of cure, then it is necessary that the two feet of the affected person be tied together firmly, lightly, above both ankles and both knees.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And its length is equal to the quantity of four fingers, and the affected leg is extended more than the other by a quantity of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then the affected limb is suspended above the head of the stick, and it is in a balance; and its length from the ground is a quantity of two arms.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then command a strong youth to pull the head of the thigh bone, and it is suspended with the affected limb another youth, and the other youth pulls the thigh bone in strength with rapid impulses, so that the joint returns to its original place with velocity.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	In the reduction proper, when there is dislocation in the affected part beforehand, it happens that the patient's joint adjusts according to how we have recommended to set the limb; and strengthen the ligament over the affected leg properly and over their chest.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And place two pillows, one under their feet, and the other at the head; and place adjusted pillows to support the middle of the affected limb over which the humors are enveloped, so that the patient is not bothered by the pillow being between their thighs, so that the extension to the affected parts is not hindered.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each minister extends to their own part, and the doctor has his hand engaged in the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Then, if you obey the retraction, it will be great; and if not, pause over that diligently and thus as we have said in the reduction for that engagement.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	It happens that the patient's joint adjusts to the healthy sides little by little.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in the anterior parts, then it happens that the leg is extended lightly, and it is according to this narrative method about the affected limb; and the doctor places the palm of his right hand on the affected groin, and then contracts that with his other hand, and in that contraction he pauses the extension to the affected parts downwards to the part of the thigh.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is in the posterior parts, then it does not happen that the affected limb is extended to the affected parts downwards, and it is elevated above the ground; however, it happens that it is placed on a hard surface, thus as it happens with the reduction if their ankle is dislocated beforehand, according to what we have said about its placement on two anchors; and it is above its face and the ligaments are extended, according to what we have said, there is no danger.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it happens that an administered compression bandage is placed on the area where the joint is located.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Then, since the reduction is completed as it happens — and the sign of the reduction of it is not hidden from you, and it is that you extend both legs of the affected limb, and when you see those joints and the affected limb stretches out the healthy leg and expands its excuse, then you know that the member has returned as it happens — and then you adjust both thighs and place a bandage around them so that the ankle is not hidden in any of the parts; and adhere the affected limb to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then release the ligament and the bandage, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see those joints in their proper place, then you know that the dislocation is already fixed, and thus the affected limb can walk again.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then you return and plaster it, and stretch it according to its first structure, and thus it will be in three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then release it, and make it delay in walking about for some days, until it is comforted.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the cure of dislocation of the thigh.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The thigh is dislocated in three ways, because it is dislocated to the anterior parts, and to the posterior parts, and sometimes to the upper parts and sometimes to the lower parts; and to the anterior parts it is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation of it is that you command the affected limb to apply its leg to the thigh; then you know that the thigh is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all its ways is that you make the affected limb straight, thus that it extends the healthy leg, if possible; tie two towels to the face of it, and place its foot between the two towels; and then make adhere the thigh of it with your two palms, and hold them together with the two towels on the thigh of it in strength, and another minister extends the healthy foot until the thigh returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of reduction of it is that its leg adheres to the thigh without labor or effort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then plaster it and make the leg adhere to the thigh, and then bind those together with a bandage for three days or four, and then release them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the affected limb for walking for some days, until it is healed and comforted.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	It happens that if the reduction of it to you is excused, then administer strong extension to the ligaments which are in the cure of the preceding narrative about the ankle.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the cure of dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	Some ankle joints are removed by small movement, and some joints are dislocated according to completeness, and the dislocation of it is made either in the posterior parts or in the anterior parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of the dislocation of it is that you see the ankle swollen proceeding to the part where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The healing of the patient's dislocation is often a long process, and it is necessary to extend and facilitate the hands so that they can be restored inward.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	Sometimes in the healing of one who is dislocated according to a compliment, it happens that you make the patient straight, and hold that strong and valiant minister behind the back of that person in the middle place.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you put your right hand on the straight foot above the ankle, and your left hand below the foot at the place of the calf.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then you draw the foot to your right hand, and then with your left hand for two fingers, and then extend your left hand; and you press the toes of the foot against the leg, just above the knee.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And make two fingers according to what we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then you press the toes of the foot against the leg at the third finger, and you are at the calf.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns to one finger or two according to this method, and if you can straighten the foot, it's good; and if not, then repeat the operation, because that will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	Sometimes if you are prohibited from reducing it with what we have recommended, then make the patient sit on their back on the ground, and stretch a strong bandage tightly around them, and enclose it between the thighs of the patient, and you have already enveloped them in a sheet so that they do not move.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And then the minister holds their thighs, and another minister extends the foot with their hands or wraps it around the neck of the foot; and then extend that same minister against the extension of the back, and the bandage is extended between the thighs of the patient, holding it, so that the body of the patient is not attracted to the lower parts below its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And then the doctor straightens the dislocation with his hands, and another minister holds the healthy thigh at the lower parts, because the dislocation returns to its facility.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And so when the dislocation returns and it is declared to you the healthiness of the reduction of it, then pause the plaster and stretch that strongly with a bandage, and bind the foot to the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And beware that you do not touch or guard the nerves which are behind the ankle, so that the bandage on it is not violent and holds it firmly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave it like that for two days or three; and if the bandage is softened, stretch it out.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then remove it on the third day or fourth, and prohibit the patient from moving for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	Sometimes if you are forced to delay in that space, it is not done securely so that the dislocation does not dissolve and corrupt, and then that which does not receive cure.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if you happen to find the apostema cautious, then beware that you administer in the sedation of it, which our narrative has preceded, in another place of cure and of embracement, until it is restored.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the Healing of Dislocation of the Toes of the Feet.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It happens that one who is dislocated can be straightened with little extension of their efforts; and that which is not difficult, therefore it is easier.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	Sometimes if the dislocation is in some nodes of the foot, then beware that you make the patient sit on their back on a flat surface or on a table, and it should be still like that as if it were normal.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand on feet, and pause the foot on what you imagine to be the joints, and then calcify that in the foot as it turns until it returns, and you see that it is already straightened and does not appear in the eminent place.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then pause below the belly of the foot on a table that holds the whole foot, which has two cups, and then strengthen it in a decent structure and hold it firm for three days; and then remove it and make it rest from walking for many days, until it is strengthened and its recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	On the Species of Dislocation that are Made by Wound or Fracture or any other Accidents.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When you encounter some cause of those, and you fail in the cure of that and in the restoration of it, many fingers succeed in death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for that you do not know that about the cure of it, except he who is wise in the art, from long usage, merciful and pitiful, slow, not hasty nor presumptuous; and who uses in the commencement of medicines that cast out apostemes so much alone, and leaves the patient to divine judgment, but hopes for salvation from perdition, with alleviation of the malady, and in which appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then it is necessary to proceed so much from the reduction in the commencement of the cause, because it will encounter a cautious aposteme.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the limb returns according to what we will, then administer a regimen that casts out cautious aposteme and cures the wound with what is convenient for it from the dry desiccations.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if a dislocation is caused by a fracture and separation of the sacrum bone, then you perforate the statement of theirs, and do so in such a way that it has been said in simple gout cases that it precedes in those locations.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And beware and avoid according to your virtue that of the instrument in the ways of fear according to what has preceded my predication; for it is better for you to give thanks to your Creator, and more permanent to your glory, and more greetings to your body very truly at that time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus the paragraphs of Albucasim are perfectly filled with those which God may bless.
Amen.	Amen.
